This is the first loan that M’Balu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian S., 38, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Julisto S., a foreman, and they are blessed with strong physiques which enable them to work hard for their family and their future together.

Lilian operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trapping. There is also seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms and such, and she does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Lilian dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
This is Loryn B., 26, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Marvin B. and mother of an energetic toddler. At this time, she is working hard to be able to afford sending him to a good school, to finish his education all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Loryn as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Loryn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Loryn dreams of being able to give her child a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes that her husband will finally be able to find work outside the country. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif A. is a young married man who breeds poultry and calves in Imishli city. Akif is full of energy and he tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Akif started his business two years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Akif has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed the work during his childhood. He is married and has two children. He would like to increase the number of chickens he keeps and build a new coop. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and build a coop

loans.name: Ilhame

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Ilhame M. has operated a business of selling dresses that are specifically intended for wedding and engagement ceremonies. She rents a place in the central bazaar of Imihsli city. Her monthly income ranges from about $375 to $625 and she would like to increase it. She also wants to be able to cover the demands of her many customers. A hard-working mother, Ilhame has successfully grown her business, inspired by her goal to establish a stable income for her family.

Currently, Ilhame is seeking a loan of 1,000 AZN to enlarge her variety of goods for sale. With the increased profits, she hopes to continue supporting her child's education. She believes that one day she will have her own shop.

loans.use: purchase more wedding dresses to sell to increase income

loans.name: Hand In Hand Group

texts.en:
Ramatu M. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in a place called Makali, 45 years ago. She is married with nine children:  four in primary school and five in secondary school. For fifteen years now, Ramatu has been selling cooked rice (the country’s staple food), soft drinks and bottled water. 

This is the first loan that Ramatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Ramatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 leones) to expand her business. She will buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil, onions, tomatoes, soft drinks, etc., in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients and soft drinks

loans.name: Mirgasim

texts.en: Mirgasim A. is 59 years old. He is married and has five children. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to farming. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Mirgasim decided to raise seasonal fruits and vegetables. He sells his products in the local bazaar, earning an income of about $375 to $500 a month. He started his business in 1985 but he applied for his first loan in 2008. He repaid his first loan from KIVA successfully. He also keeps a shop of spare parts for cars, but his main business is farming because his products are in very high demand. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. With the loan, Mirgasim will purchase seeds and fertilizer for improving his land and his crops.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Just Emagine Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, working in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Just Emagine Group. The entrepreneurs, who run small-scale businesses, have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 500,000 leones each to invest in their businesses. 

Marie Lee (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Marie is 45 years old and married with two children:  one in primary school and one in secondary school. Marie sells cotton and wax cloths and has been doing this business for ten years. With the help of this loan, Marie will invest in her business by buying cotton and wax cloths.

loans.use: To buy cotton and wax cloths

loans.name: Kathegbeh Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, working in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Kathegbeh Group. They are women running small-scale businesses based in Makeni city. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses. Pictured on the left is Hawa T., who is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Makeni. She is age 37 and married to a teacher. The couple has three children: one in primary school and two in secondary school. Hawa sells dishes, rubber bowls, cloths, etc. She has had ten years of experience in the business. With her share of the loan, Hawa will buy stock in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy dishes, rubber bowls, cloths, etc.

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en: Elmaddin A. is 28 years old and lives with his wife, parents and a small child. He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard worker and very dedicated to his agricultural work, raising cattle. Elmaddin saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. Elmaddin has an income of about $250 to $375 a month and would like to increase it to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. In order to do so, Elmaddin is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality.

loans.use: purchase one cow and 6 sheep

loans.name: Nazaria Cesar

texts.pt:
Nazaria César M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos de 6 e 13 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 10ª classe, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe algum valor monetário para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Saiu da sua terra natal para a Republica da Africa do sul quando casou se, volta a zona de origem depois da separação e inicia uma atividade comercial como forma de sustentar seus filhos. Não possui nenhum empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.500.00mt a 9.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu pai que também foi cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, vinho, água e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma residência e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a seus filhos.
texts.en:
Nazaria César in Maputo, in the Province of the same name, South of Mozambique. She is the mother of two children who are 6 and 13 years old. Both children go to school. She went to school until 10th grade. She lives in her own home and supports her mother sending her some money to help with household expenses. She left her homeland to go to South Africa when she got married. She came back home after she got divorced and started a business as a way to support her children. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of around 7,500 to 9,500 meticais per month, which is spent in household expenses. She also manages to save some in his bank account. She has never had loans from other banks. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her father who is also partners of this institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais. She intends to buy products (beer, soda, wine, water and others) to increase her inventory. She intends to request more loans in the future to build a house and to offer better living conditions to her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of inventory (beer, sodas, wine, water and others)

loans.name: Belek Group

texts.en:
The “Belek” solidarity group was created on the 16th of June, 2010. It is made up of four persons from Belek village who have the same interests in animal breeding. In this village, cattle breeding is the main means of subsistence and maintenance of the family for many people. 

Gulkaky S. is the leader of the group. She is 55, married and has one son of school age. Gulkaky started her milk-selling business by purchasing a milch (dairy) cow. Today, this activity brings her about 2,500 Kyrgyzstan Soms (KGS) monthly.   

Gulkaky applies for a loan to buy one more milch (dairy) cow, which will allow her to increase the amount of milk for selling. With the revenues, Gulkaky plans to give a good education to her son. She also wishes to take her family on a good vacation some day.

Group members:

Roza M. is 49 years old, single and has one son, who is 8 years old. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for 15 years. Roza started her business with her initial investment of 3,000 KGS.  She plans to use this loan to purchase two bull calves for fattening and reselling.
 
Chinarkul C. is 28, divorced and has one son. Seven years ago, in order to meet the expenses of her small family, she started her business in cattle breeding. She milks cows and sells dairy products to loyal customers. Using this loan,  Chinarkul plans to buy two bull calves for fattening and reselling. 

Chingiz T. is the youngest member of the group. He is 22 years old and single. He works in a confectioner's shop and helps his parents with animal breeding. Chingiz began his own business in fattening cattle five years ago. He also wants to obtain a loan to buy two bull calves for further reselling.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en: Khayal I. is married and has a young son. He runs his own business selling food products. The monthly income of his shop is about $315 to $375. Khayal is also working as a school teacher but his salary is only about $100 a month.  This is why he started this business five years ago. Because of his experience he is able to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Khayal needs a loan of 800 AZN. He is going to spend the loan to purchase more dry goods to sell, which will increase his income and enable him to buy a cow.

loans.use: pruchase more goods to sell and buy one cow

loans.name: Afreddin

texts.en:
Afreddin A. is 57 years old and is married with three children. He has been engaged in farming and cattle breeding since 1995. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. 

Afreddin`s income is about $310-$375 a month and he is on the way to increasing it but only if he can get some financial support.  He applied for a loan of 900 AZN to rear calves, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, he will purchase calves and feed for them to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase calves and feed for them

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan A. is a farmer. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Gulshan puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts and cattle breeding because she is aware that they can help her children.  

She sells fattened cattle to the local butchers and fruits to the local bazaar traders. Her monthly income is about $250-$315 and it is not enough to cover basic family needs. The unconditional support that she receives from her children provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. 

Her wish to improve the living conditions of her family brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products. Gulshan asks for a loan of 600 AZN. She wants to purchase one milk cow and seeds.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and seeds

loans.name: Ernesto Luis Novela

texts.pt:
Ernesto luis Novela U. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 5 a 12 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria cedida pelos pais, com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.

Saiu da sua cidade natal para Boane com seus pais, é pedreiro de profissão ha mais de 15 anos e trabalha com 3 ajudantes. Consegue um valor de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês depois das despesas dos seus ajudantes, onde consegue poupar algo em casa para eventuais situações.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, portas, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt e foi para a aquisição de bens.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Ernesto Luis Novela U. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He has four children between the ages of 5 and 12; the 3 eldest go to school. Ernesto only finished sixth grade and did not continue because of his parents' financial troubles. He and his family live in his own house, which his parents gave to him, and he supports his parents, who live with him. He left his hometown to come to Boane with his parents. Ernesto has been a stonemason for more than 15 years and works with three helpers. He earns about 3,500 meticais per month after paying his helpers, and he manages to save some money at home for unforeseen circumstances. He has never had loans with other banks. Ernesto learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This is his second loan. He is asking for 10,000 meticais, and he intends to buy construction material (iron, cement, doors, beams, and other items) to continue building his home. The earlier loan was for 7,000 meticais and was for purchasing property. In the future he intends to ask for more loans to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (iron, cement, doors, beams and other items)

loans.name: Kibimbiri Development Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
With modest earnings he has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that have hit his garment sales business occasionally. N. David, aged 52 years, is a member of the Kibimbiri development group in Kihihi, and he gleefully reveals how, with his small profits, he is able to educate three out of his six children who are still enrolled in different institutions of learning.

He operates a six-year-old garment sales business from Kihihi town, selling clothes at monthly and weekly markets in the area and earns about $143 on a monthly basis. What has inspired him most about his business is having learned the prevailing market in the area from local occupants. It is for this reason that he wants to get this loan to improve his financial gain prospects by restocking his business with attractive materials and more bales of clothes.

loans.use: purchase of clothes to sell

loans.name: Umubano Group

texts.fr:
Chantal U. est une commerçante âgée de 36 ans qui habite au Quartier 3 Ngangara en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de viande de bœuf. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 5 ans alors qu’elle faisait le commerce de produits de boutique. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 4e année des études primaires. Son mari, Isaac Minani est aussi un commerçant de bœufs. Elle arrive au 6e  cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 5enfants qui sont âgés de 8ans, 6ans ,5ans, 3ans et 5mois. Les 4 premiers sont à l’école. Elle prend aussi en charge 3 autres enfants de la famille proche. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de viande de bœuf  à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle a été inspirée par son mari dans ce business. Son mari  l’a aidé pour démarrer son business  et le crédit de Turame est venu pour majorer son capital. 

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Umubano»
texts.en:
Chantal U. is a 36 year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Ngangara 3 neighborhood of Bujumbura Mairie. She sells beef, a trade she has plied for five years while selling grocery products. She attended school up to the fourth year of elementary school. Her husband, Isaac Minani, also sells beef. She is on her third group loan cycle with the Turame association. She is the mother of five children, ages 8, 6, 5, 3 and 5 months. The oldest four children are in school. She also cares for 3 other children of close relatives. She is asking for a Kiva loan so she can buy more beef to sell in the hopes of making a large profit. She hopes to have more capital in the future which will enable her to operate a large business. She has been inspired by her husband, who helped her to start up this business. The loan from Turame will be used to increase her capital. She is one of the members of the “Umubano” community group.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obuy more beef to sell in the hopes of making a large profit

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week, selling her products at the market.    

Deborah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Deborah include seasonality and transportation problems.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand clothes. 

She lives in a home that she rents and where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Abaduzakivi Group

texts.fr:
Denise N. est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite au Quartier 3 Ngangara en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les pommes de terre et les œufs. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année de l’enseignement technique en Gestion. Son mari, Alberic Barangeza est aussi un commerçant de produits de boutique. Elle fait juste le 1er  cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2enfants, un garçon et une fillette  qui sont âgés de  6ans et 5ans.Ils sont tous à l’école. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de produits alimentaires (pommes de terre et œufs de poule) à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle a été inspirée par ses parents pour commencer le business car c’est le métier qu’ils exercent depuis très longtemps. Elle reçu le premier capital de son mari pour démarrer son business avant d’avoir le crédit de Turame. 

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « Abaduzakivi»
texts.en:
Denise N. is a 27-year-old merchant who lives in Quartier 3 Ngangara, in Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  She does commerce in foodstuffs, such as potatoes and eggs.  This has been her trade for seven years. Denise has attended the 2nd year of technical education in management.  She is on her first community loan cycle with Turame.  Her husband, Alberic Barangeza, is also a merchant of shop goods.   Denise is the mother of two children, a boy and a girl, who are 6 and 5 years old.  They are both in school.  Denise is asking for a Kiva loan to increase the quantity of goods (potatoes and chicken eggs) to sell in hopes of having a big profit.  She hopes to have a lot of capital in the future to allow her to do a lot of business.  She was inspired by her parents to start this business because it was their trade for a long time.  She received initial capital from her husband for starting her business before her loan from Turame. She is a member of the solidarity group "Abaduzakivi". 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the quantity of goods (potatoes and chicken eggs) to sell in hopes of having a big profit

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El comité “Mujeres Unidas 3” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Roque Alonso.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas , tres integrantes son empleadas Domesticas y una Empleada publica ,estas señoras también trabajan en  ventas de varios productos en sus horas libres o fin de semanas. 
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Nancy es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, además fabrica sabanas, almohadones, manteles, servilletas, también fábrica estuches para muestrarios de joyas y otras artesanías. 
En fin realiza realiza varias actividades, es un señora muy creativa en su actividad, y todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con varios  hijos y su marido quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Nancy solicita el crédito para la compra de maquina especial para colocar broches a las confecciones que realiza.
texts.en:
Description: The “Mujeres Unidas 3” (United Women 3) group was formed by several neighbors from the city of Roque Alonso. All of the group members are involved in independent activities. Some are in sales, others prepare fast food. Three are domestic employees and one is a public employee. They also work selling several kinds of products during their spare time or on weekends. The members make up a very solid group capable of group activities that strengthen their companionship. Nancy is one of the group members. She manufactures clothing for women, men and children. She also makes sheets, pillow cases, tablecloths, napkins. In addition, she also makes jewelry cases and other crafts. In other words, she’s a very creative woman who is involved in a wide variety of activities. All of her customers are always in awe of her work. She has a very united family composed of her husband, who works as a Security Guard, and several children. She is very happy with her activity and with the training the group receives. Nancy is asking for funds to buy a special machine to install clasps on the articles of clothing she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a special machine that installs clasps.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (three grand children, an aunt and a cousin).  

Rose has a business of selling charcoal. Previously she was dealing in food vending.  She has been in this business for a year, and works seven days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home.  

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through making school chalk. The main business challenges for Rose include thieves and transportation problems. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to built a shelter for her charcoal.  Rose lives in a home that she owns and where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcaol

loans.name: Shirri

texts.en:
Shirri M. was born in 1970. She is single and God has blessed her with children. She shares three rooms with her children and other external family members. She lives in Musang mankon, a quarter in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon.

She has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to provide for her daily needs to the failure to attain quality education. She also reiterates how happy she was when she gave birth to a set of twins. 

With this loan, Shirri plans to invest in the business of buying and selling of foodstuffs like cocoa yams, yams, corn, potatoes and beans. She is convinced that the business will succeed because this is not her first time receiving a loan from GHAPE and investing in the same business, and also that the previous investment was successful. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide general provisions in the form of food items. Her neighbors will not need to incur transportation costs to buy them elsewhere in distant places. 

With her income from the business she will be able to take care of her children’s education. She will plow back her profits into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to upgrade her standard of living. She also wants to open a workshop for her son. 

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and also that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan, and that payment is gradual.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase general provisions to sell

loans.name: Neba Emilia

texts.en:
Neba Emelia M. was born in 1969. She is married to Neba Clement Ngwa and they are blessed with five children. She shares five rooms with her five children, where they live at Musang, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Emelia has faced difficulties in life ranging from ill-health, the inability to meet her daily needs, and the untimely death of her relatives. Her failure to attain a quality education has contributed to her inability to afford basic necessities like lighting. With this loan, she plans to invest it in her food buying and selling business which she has had for several years.  She is convinced that the business will succeed because she has a business strategy that is unique. She also thinks her business site has a lot to do with her success since it is located inside the main market of her village. Also, she sees her low price policy as a tool to capture customers which adds to her success in business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford foodstuffs at relatively low prices and will not need to incur the transport costs to buy food from distant places. 

The profit from her loan will help her to take care of her children’s education. She will put back her profit into her business and use part of it to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children Meducation when they are sick and upgrade her standard of living. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.


The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase beans, vegetables and cassava.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 29 años es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 36 años y sus dos queridos hijos Jayer de 8 y Ángel de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. A través de estos años Gladys ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja sus tierras, para que sean mas productivas. La papa y arveja que cultiva, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyan y guían sus compañeras del grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old. She is a very unpretentious and happy person. She lives in her own home together with her husband Jose, 36 years old, and their two beloved children, Jayer, 8 years old, and Angel, 4 years old. They are the driving force behind all her efforts. Over the years Gladys has worked very hard in her plantations to yield high quality harvests. Every morning she and her husband work the fields so make them more productive. The potato and sweet pea harvests are sold in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest. She has 10 years' experience in the field. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport the harvest to the markets where it will be sold. In time she hopes to cultivate the entire expanse of her fields to increase production. This loan is the first she requests through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. She wishes to acquire future loans to keep developing her business. She knows that the community bank will support her and guide her along with the other colleagues of her group. With the thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to achieve a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Karina Azucena

texts.es: La joven Karina Azucena posee la compra y venta e chatarra ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 3 años, ya que este negocio es bien solicitado por los clientes, debido a que es muy importante mantener a su familia, ya esta actividad le gusta mucho ya que contribuye al medio ambiente. Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de chatarra de todo tipo, gracias a Dios y a su arduo esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante, ella y sus 2 hijos, uno de sus hijos asiste al colegio, ella cuenta con los servicios básicos gracias al trabajo que realiza diario.
texts.en:
The young Karina Azucena has collects and sells scrap metals, a business she has managed from her home for the past 3 years. This business is popular with her clientele and it is very important for the support of her family. She really enjoys her work and she appreciates that is is for the good of the environment. She requests a loan to purchase scrap metals of all kinds. Thanks to God and to her hard work she has been able to support herself and her two children. One of her children is attending school. She is able to have basic services in her home thanks to the hard work she carries out every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
V. is married with three children. All the children are less than fifteen years of age. She join GHAPE in 2005 and has managed to successfully repay fours loans. Since she joined GHAPE, she has been able to carry out income generating activities. Her husband has joined her in her business since she is able to provide capital from GHAPE.

With her new loan, she plans to invest in the buying and selling of groundnuts, both fresh and dry. She also plans to buy egusi from far off villages for retail sale in the main city. Her business will help to supply her community with groundnut and egusi which is mostly used in cooking soup that is served with many food items in the community.

This business will succeed because she has been doing it for a very long time and there are available customers to buy from her since she always buy in bulk.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of fresh and dry groundnut and Egusi

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda, de 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos Nilton de 30 y Ángel 24 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida. El trabajo que Hermelinda se dedica, es el cultivo de papas, zanahorias, arvejas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos y de los cambios climáticos. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en insumos para cuidar sus plantas ya que tener sus campos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, age 51, is a simple hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her two children Nilton, 30, and Angel, 24, to whom she wishes to give a better life. Hermelinda makes a living planting potatoes, carrots and peas. Early every morning she tends to her crops since she knows that the price she will get depends on their quality. She sells her goods in the Tarma and La Merced markets since that is where she gets the best prices. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting the crops since that is when she sees the pay-off for months of work. She has been doing this for 21 yeas and feels that the most difficult part is protecting her fields from plagues and weather. In the future she hopes to improve her yields to increase her income. This is her eighth loan with MFP and say that his loan will help her work significantly. She is well loved by her partners in her community bank since she is very supportive. She will invest the 2500 Nuevos Soles she is requesting in various goods to care for her plants and keep them free from plagues.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods to treat plagues in her fields

loans.name: Tibui

texts.en:
R. was married to a polygamist and has four children. Due to matrimonial problems, she is now separated from her husband. She decided to join GHAPE in 2007 because she was unable to provide food and medication to the family. Also, she was unable to have enough capital to continue her seamstress work. She took her first loan and invested it in her tailoring workshop and also did some farming which raised her income and helped her to provide for her family.

R. has successfully managed and repaid two loans. She plans on using her third loan to invest in the buying of cloth to make dresses, pig feed, and to buy fertilizer for the farming of vegetables.

She believes that her loan will help her succeed because she has obtained knowledge from GHAPE on business management. Also, vegetables are highly consumed by many people in her community, especially during ceremonies.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of cloth, fertilizer for the farming of vegetables

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 19 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Miguel de 24 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Trabajando arduamente, Irene ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos de papa, maíz y arveja, gracias a todo su esfuerzo, sus cultivos son de los mejores de su poblado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que el trabajo que realizó meses atrás dio sus frutos. En adelante, espera incrementar la cantidad que produce actualmente, para eso comprará nuevas tierras. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Irene, 19, is an unassuming, hard working young woman. She lives in her parents’ house with her husband, Miguel, 24. What she most desires is to succeed in life. Working hard, Irene has managed to raise her potato, corn and pea crops. Thanks to all her efforts her crops are the best in her settlement. Because of this, when she takes them to Tarma to sell they are quickly bought. What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting her crops because that’s when she sees the fruits of the past months’ labors. She’d like to increase her crop yields so will buy more land to do so in the future. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that the loan will be very helpful for her business’ progress and development so she is willing to repay on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well-liked. She will use the 700 new soles to buy fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: G/s Genesis Group

texts.es: Julia Alejandrina P. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en la Colonia El Eden junto a sus tres hijos de 27, 25 y 24 años. Julia comenzò vendiendo medicinas naturales de forma ambulante, en la mayoria del tiempo recorriendo a pie gran parte de la ciudad mientras sus hijos iban a la escuela. Luego de un tiempo cambiò de negocio y actualmente por el dia se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para mujeres y niños, blusas, faldas, sandalias, pantalones largos y cortos; por la noche trabaja en un pequeño Restaurante que se llama Las Dos Torres donde elabora una variedad de golosinas. Julia solicita el prestamo de Lps. 7,000 para comprar una mayor cantidad de ropa sobretodo estilos que esten de moda, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas llamando la atencion de mas personas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y no seguir pagando alquiler, y una pequeña tienda y que le permita seguir obteniendo ganancias ya que tiene un nieto a su cargo y necesita el dinero para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Sus companeras de grupo son Lilian y Luisa. Lilian se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, y tambien trabaja en el Restaurante La Dos Torres pero por el dia, solicita un prestamo de Lps. 5,000. Luisa se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos, tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos, ella sufre de Cataratas, solicita un prestamo de Lps. 5,000. Este es el segundo prestamo que el grupo solicita en FAMA y son han demostrado que son personas muy responsables en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia Alejandrina P., 48, is a single mother living in the El Edén neighborhood with her three children who are 27, 25 and 24 years of age. Julia started to sell natural remedies in an itinerant way spending most of the time walking the streets of a large part of the city while her children were in school. After some time, she changed her line of work and now she sells women’s and children’s underwear, blouses, skirts, sandals, long and short pants during the day. At night she works in a small restaurant called Las Dos Torres where she prepares a variety of snacks. Julia is asking for a Lps. 7000 loan to buy a larger amount of clothes, especially those in season so that she can attract more customer attention and increase sales. Her dream is to own her own home and stop paying rent and to have a small store that will allow her to continue to earn income because she also has a grandson under her care and needs money to support her household. Her fellow group members are Lilian and Luisa. Lilian sells clothes and shoes and also works at the Las Dos Torres restaurant but during days. Luisa sells clothes and cosmetics. She has an eye problem, though: cataracts. This is the second loan the group has requested from FAMA and they have demonstrated that they are very responsible people with regard to their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 33 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y sencillo, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven Jesús se dedicó al cultivo de papa, arveja y maíz, ya que esta es la actividad que ha realizado su familia desde hace mucha generaciones, sus productos los vende a los compradores, que llegan hasta sus chacras, quienes posteriormente llevan el producto a vender a la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Jesús is a simple, hard-working man. He lives with his parents and wishes most of all to have a better quality of life. Since he was very young, he has grown potatoes, peas, and corn. His family has been farmers for many generations. He sells his products to buyers who come to his cultivated plots and take the products to the city of Lima and sell them. What he most enjoys about his work is tending to his plantings, which he does with much care. After 20 years doing this work, he feels that spraying the plots is the most difficult part of his work. In time, he wants to buy more land to increase his production. This is his first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma (local lending institution). He knows he must make his payments on time and is prepared to do so. In his village bank, he is very well-respected by the other members. With the 1,000 nuevos soles ($375), he will buy more fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es: Cruz Del Socorro tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es la venta de derivados de leche. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su negocio. esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido gratificante, Ella inicio por la demanda y la necesidad de de tener su propio trabajo ya que al no poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios busco la forma de mantener a su familia, con mucho empeño ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Este financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema y queso. Desea mejorar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cruz del Socorro is 55 years old and her economic activity is selling milk derivatives. For more than 22 years she has been dedicated to this business, and she is always looking for a way to improve her business. This isn't the first time Cruz has had financing, which has always been gratifying. She began working because of product demand, and the necessity of having her own work. Since she couldn't finish her university studies, Cruz searched for a form of maintaining her family. With much effort, she has been able to remain active. This loan is for buying milk, curd, cream and cheese. Cruz wishes to improve the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MILK, CURD, CREAM, AND CHEESE TO SELL

loans.name: John

texts.es: John, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Con muchas ganas de trabajar John sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de papa, arveja y maíz, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de los insectos. En adelante, espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
John is 21 years old and is very easy-going and hard-working. He lives with his parents and what he wants most is to improve their quality of life. He is very eager to work and goes every day to cultivate his land. He mainly grows potatoes, peas and corn. These products sell quickly in the Tarma market due to their good quality. The thing that he likes most about this work is cultivating the land. He has been doing this for a year now and what he considers most difficult is protecting his land from insects. In the future, he hopes that his production improves since he depends on this for income. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to have obtained it and will make his payments on time. He is well-liked in his communal bank. With the 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that he is requesting he will buy fertilizer for his farms because he wants to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es: Modesta Alicia se dedica a la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser clientes de Fundación, pues ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Pues su negocio es importante para mantenerse y pagar los gastos del hogar. Ella elabora deliciosos prisionero y queques, hace más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio. Actualmente este crédito es para comprar  maíz, leña, queso, mantequilla, huevos, azúcar y leche. Desea seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que así puede proporcionar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Modesta Alicia bakes and sells products from her oven. She has been a client of the Foundation for a long time, and has demonstrated that she will make her payments properly and on time. Her business is important for her maintenance and paying household expenses. For more than 25 years, Modesta has made delicious pastries and cakes. The present loan is for buying corn, firewood, cheese, lard, eggs, sugar and milk. Modesta wants to forge ahead with her business, so that she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTES TO BAKE PASTRIES AND CAKES TO SELL

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: en 2003, N. kossiwa s'est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes et de tissus bazins, pour conquérir plus de client elle dans le quartier de kégué et de ses alentours fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.Voulant dynamiser son stock elle sollicite pour sa première fois de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de pagnes et de bazins de diverses Qualités.elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, N’ZONOU Kossiwa began to sell pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) and bazin fabric. In order to win over more customers, she operates as an itinerant vendor in the Kégué neighborhood and the surrounding area. She gets her stock at the large market in Lomé. She wants to pep up her stock, so is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy various kinds of pagnes and bazins. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and bazin fabric

loans.name: Rigoberto Santos

texts.es: Rigoberto Santos M. de 46 años de edad, reside en el Municipo de la Union en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace un tiempo en una parte de su domicilio tiene instalado un taller donde arregla motocicletas y gracias a este negocio ha logrado sostener a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y ademas atiende una pequeña pulperia, y sus 6 hijos de 18,16,14,13,11 y 4 años de edad, de los cuales 4 se dedican a estudiar en el colegio y 1 en la escuela de la localidad. Èl solicita el prestamo para surtir su negocio de repuestos como ser llantas, fricciones, juegos de traccion, rines, bufias, entre otros. Espera tener mas clientes y que su negocio poco a poco vaya creciendo y que le deje mayores ganancias para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar. Su esposa e hijos lo consideran un hombre luchador y cariñoso, somos una familia humilde pero unidad expresò uno de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un local mas grande y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Es su primer credito en FAMA y esperamos una buena conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Santos M. is forty-six years old and lives in the municipality of Union, in the department of Olancho. For some time now he has had a workshop in his home where he fixes up motorcycles. He has been able to support his family thanks to this business. His wife spends her time taking care of the house and she also takes care of a small general store. His six children are ages 18,16,14,13,11 and 4. Four of his children are in high school and one goes to grade school. He is taking out a loan to stock his spare-parts business and bit-by-bit be able to grow and earn more money to keep on supporting his home. His wife and children see him as a caring man who fights hard for what he needs. "We are a humble, yet tight family," the children said. His dream is to have a bigger place and to provide his family with a higher standard of living. This is his first loan with FAMA and we are expecting good behavior in terms of payment.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motercyle parts.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred K. is a gentleman who is married to Everline Nafula.  They have two children whom they are raising, ages 25 and 20 years old. 

Alfred's primary business is molding bricks, which he has done for eight years, but he also has a secondary business of tailoring clothes for resale. He sells the molds to secondary schools within his locality. He says that he can take home a profit of Kshs 7,500 on a good month and this is able to meet his family’s needs. 

Alfred joined KADET after learning about it from a meeting that had been organized by a World Vision Initiative within his region. This will mark his first loan and he hopes to use the money to add more logs for the brick molding work and more fabric stock for his tailoring business.  The extra profit will be put back into the businesses.

Alfred hopes to become a master distributor of bricks within the locality.

loans.use: To buy logs for brick moulding and to add more fabric stock for his secondary business of tailoring

loans.name: Zaliatou

texts.fr: K. est une femme de 36 ans très dynamique. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales. elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 7 ans déjà et elle en a une parfaite maîtrise. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié pour réaliser de meilleures bénéfices. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d'haricots, 2 sacs de mil et divers autres céréales. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a 36-year-old woman who is very dynamic. She sells cereals and has done so for more than 7 years and is an expert at it. She buys her stock from the interior of the country in the city of Anié to obtain better profits. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can buy 5 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of millet, and several other cereals. She is married and has 3 children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Iván de 41 años y sus tres menores hijos, a los que desea dar una mejor vida. Junto a su esposo, Julia trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra arveja, ya que esta plata leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, por eso comprará abono.
texts.en:
Julia, 36, is a very loving mother and worker. She lives in a rented house with her husband, Ivan, who is 41 and his three young children, to whom she would like to provide a better life. Julia and her husband work on their crops every day. With much effort, she has been been able to make their lands very productive so they are now able to grow everything, since she knows that any product she gets will be good. She mainly plants peas since this silver legume is selling very well in the market. What she likes most about her job is protecting their crops from the pests that can affect them. She has been doing this for 11 years and believes that the most difficult part is transporting the crops to the wholesale market Tarma, where she sells her products. For the future, she hopes to raise the money required to have a stall in the wholesale market, because she currently sells on foot. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she feels that this loan will help a lot in the development of their business. She is a member of their communal bank and is very responsible, which she is very proud of. The 1,500 PEN requested, will be invested in improving their crops so she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Phanic

texts.en:
Phanic M. is a 28-year-old single gentleman. He is a cattle trader who buys cattle from other traders and later sells them at a profit. His business is located in the open air market at Bungoma where many traders frequent.

Phanic joined KADET after an awareness campaign was done in his area of operation by the World Vision staff where KADET is a subsidiary. This will be his first loan and he hopes to use the funds to buy more cattle for resale.

In the future he would like to open a butcher shop where he can sell some cattle as meat. He believes that his hard work will in the end payoff.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pagnes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 25 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Herminio de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Luzmila sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos son la papa, el maíz y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr la producción. Para el futuro, comprar más tierras para sembrar más café. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 25 years old and is an easygoing and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Hermino who is 29 years old and their two dear children to whom they want to give the best quality of life. Luzmila leaves very early every morning to work in the fields. For her, rest days don't exist since she has to continually work her farm in order for it to be productive. Her main products are potatoes, corn and peas which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. The thing that she likes most about her job is the freedom that she has working with her crops. She has been doing this for 6 years and she considers the pests that can ruin production her greatest challenge. In the future, she would like to buy more land in order to plant more coffee. This is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to be punctual with her payments. She is very well-liked among the rest of her fellow member in her communal bank since she is so cheerful. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting she will buy more fertilizer to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: B. est âgée de 32 ans et vit avec son époux dans le quartier de gblinkomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle fait comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois et autres. elle a une ancienneté de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans les villes de Kanté et adjingré. son stock est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de d'une trentaine de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the Gblinkomé neighborhood, which is one of Lomé's outer neighborhoods. She sells various kinds of charcoal. She has more than 10 years of experience in this trade. She buys her stock from within the country in the cities of Kanté and Adjingré. Her stock is low, and she would like to buy more. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can buy approximately 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Familas Productivas Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “FAMILIAS PRODUCTIVAS ”
P. R. Deyanira Justina,tiene 52 años vive en el AA.HH diez de octubre 2da etapa en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho.-casada madre de dos hijos el primero de 19 años que estudia computación e informática en un instituto y el segundo de 15 años que esta en 5to de secundaria.
Justina ejerce el cargo de presidenta  de la alcancía“FAMILAS PRODUCTIVAS” es una alcancía nueva recién formada;sus compañeras vieron en ella que es una mujer muy  carismática y sobre todo muy responsable; cualidades básicas para  encabezar un grupo  compuesta. Por 7 entusiastas y comprometidas socias.
 Justina es cosmetóloga;lleva 20 años con esta profesión y también se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza,por las mañanas trabaja en su propia casa como independiente en un pequeño ambiente que acondiciono, pero por las tarde ella trabaja como dependiente en un salón de belleza y también se dedica a dar clase sobre productos de belleza en los lugares cercanos donde lo soliciten
 Justina sueña con tener su propio salón de belleza en un lugar mas céntrico donde pueda tener bastante clientela es por eso que el reciente préstamo lo utilizara como capital de trabajo comprando una mejor maquina para cortar el cabello y algunos insumos que necesita.
texts.en:
FAMILIAS PRODUCTIVAS (PRODUCTIVE FAMILIES) COMMUNAL BANK Deyanira Justina Pérez Ramírez, 52, lives in Diez de Octubre-2nd Stage Human Settlement in San Juan de Lurigancho District. She’s married and has two children, the oldest, 19, who studies computer sciences and technology in an institute and the second, who is 15, and in secondary school. Justina is President of the “FAMILAS PRODUCTIVAS” communal bank, a new, recently formed bank. Her fellow group members recognized her for being a charismatic, very responsible woman-basic quality to lead a group. It has 7 enthusiastic, committed members. Justina has been a cosmetologist for 20 years. She also sells beauty products. During the morning she works independently from home in a small area she set up for this but in the afternoons she is employed at a beauty salon. She also leads workshops on beauty products in nearby places that request her to do so. Justina dreams with having her own beauty salon in a centrally located spot where she can have a large number of customers. This is why she will use the recent loan as working capital to buy a better hair clipper as well as some supplies she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a better hair clipper.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 31 años, es una madre de familia que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, vive en la casa de su suegra, junto a su esposo Fredy de 26 años y su querido hijo Bryan, a quien desea brindar unos buenos estudios. Los verdes campos del poblado de Huaracayo (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), han sido en la vida de Luzmila un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar arvejas y choclos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 31 years old, is the mother of a family and has struggled always to get ahead. She lives in her mother-in-law's house with her husband Fredy, who is 26, and her dear son Bryan, to whom she wishes to offer a good education. The green fields of Huaracayo (a district of Tarma province) have always been a feature of Luzmila's life. This is a very agreeable place to work. Since she was very small, Luzmila's parents taught her farming skills and, now, she has her own lands in which she works with much care and sacrifice. What Luzmila likes most about her work is cultivating vetch and corn. She has been doing this for 21 years. What she considers most difficult is transporting her harvests to where she sells them, the market of Tarma. In time, she hopes to establish a small stall in the market, because she believes she loses much by selling them at wholesale. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she understands the responsibility of making all her payments punctually which she is disposed to do. Within her communal bank she is always up to date on the agreements they arrive at. With the 1,000 new sols she requests Luzmila will buy vetch seeds, since this leguminous plant is selling very well in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING VETCH SEEDS TO SOW

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: A. kossivi a une moto qu'il exploite comme un taxi moto, ayant remarqué la rentabilité de ce type d'activité , il souhaite acheter une moto de plus pour accroître ses revenus raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un second crédit. il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'il a bien remboursé. il est marié et père de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Kossivi A. has a motorcycle that he uses as a taxi, having noticed the profitability of such a service. He would like to buy another motorcycle so he can increase his profits. This is why he's requesting his second loan through WAGES. He has already obtained one previous loan through WAGES which he repaid in full. He is married and has 4 children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Djamila

texts.fr: A. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'agoè Kitidjan. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce charbons de bois, plus tard elle a associé ce commerce la vente de sacs de maïs. son stock de marchandises actuel ne pouvant satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 23 sacs de charbons de bois, 5 sacs de maïs et divers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Allasani is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the Kitidjan neighborhood of Agoè. Her revenue-generating activity is the retail commerce of charcoal, to which she added selling bags of corn at a later date. Her current stock supply is insufficient to meet her customers' needs, which is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 23 bags of charcoal, 5 bags of corn and various items.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 29 años, con quien trabaja en la chacra y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo Aldair una mejor vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Marcela trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará 5 sacos de semillas de arveja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero, ya que cada saco le está costando seiscientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcela, 39, is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Oscar, 29, and she works with him on a farm. Together, they want to provide a better life for their beloved son, Aldair. Working arduously each day in their fields, Marcela is changing their lives. With her husband she plants beans, corn, and gladioli, which they sell in the markets of Tarma and La Merced, since this is where they can obtain the best prices. What she likes most about her work is to care for the plantings so that they remain free of diseases and pests. She has been doing this work for 19 years, and what she considers most difficult is to take her products to the markets where they are sold, since she must carry sacks that are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and in this way obtain better prices. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will be very beneficial in helping her to grow as a farmer. In her communal bank she is a very active and cooperative member. With the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy 5 sacks of pea seeds. She will use all of the loan proceeds this way, since each sack is costing her 600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Ida Marie Claire

texts.fr: cette femme exerce depuis 2003 le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock avec 10 sacs de riz, 15 bidons d'huile et 1 cartons de sucre. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Since 2003 this woman has been a retail merchant of general food products. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé and has a wide customer base. At present she is facing a stock shortage and is requesting a loan that will enable her to increase her stock with 10 bags of rice, 15 containers of vegetable oil and one carton of sugar. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: Adja

texts.fr: adja exerce comme activité le commerce de céréales, elle a une ancienneté de un an et demi dans ce commerce. elle 'approvisionne au marché local d'agoé. pour accroître son revenu elle a ajouté à son activité la vente de charbons de bois. voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 sacs de charbons, 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de mil et divers. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Adja is a retail merchant of grain cereals, with a seniority of 1.5 years in this commercial activity. She gets her supplies from the local market in Agoé, and now also retails charcoal as a side business to increase her income. Wishing to resupply she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy five bags of corn, two bags of millet and various items. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal and charcoal

loans.name: Dina Margod

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina Margot; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de calzados y también se dedica a realizar bordados y tejidos que luego los vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio de venta de calzados y también quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer sus bordados.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Dina Margot is a member of the communal bank Virgen del Rosario del Cusco which is located in the Wanchaq district in the Cusco province. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities between her business of selling footwear and embroidery and knitting which she sells independently. She wants to improve her footwear sales business and she also wants to have a store where she can sell her needlework. She is requesting a loan to buy materials to do her needlework. She is grateful to all who are a part of funding this dream and is committed to repaying the loan in the term established.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase needlework materials

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Salome; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es divorciada, ella tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la artesanía, ella anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo verduras y poco a poco empezó en el negocio de la artesanía; ella necesita el dinero para comprar chullos hechos en lana de oveja, guantes hechos también en lana de ovino y vender al por menor.
