La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de guante y chullos (gorras) al por mayor de los proveedores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Virgen de la O community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sra. Maria Salome. She is 47 years old, divorced, with 3 children. She operates a business selling craft products. She used to make a living selling vegetables but she has built the new business bit by bit. She now needs a loan to buy wholesale stocks of "chullos" (a traditional knitted hat) and gloves, both made from sheep's wool, which she will resell. Sra. Maria is grateful to all of those who are making her dream come true and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of knitted products to resell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, ella es artesana por herencia, desde sus abuelos, elaboran bellos telares, mantas en lana de ovino y maletas tejidas recubiertas con lona para maletines. La socia necesita el dinero para invertir en el capital de trabajo para comprar los materiales y elaborar los telares. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para hacer los telares.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Virgen de la O community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sra. Lorenza. She is 39 years old and the single mother of 4 children. She operates a business making and selling traditional crafts. She learned the business from her grandparents who taught her how to make beautiful textiles, woven-wool blankets and even woven bags with canvas covers that can be used as carry-alls. Sra. Lornenza needs the loan to buy materials for making her products. Sra. Lorenza is grateful to all those who have made this loan possible and she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for crafts business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Manuel de 36 años y de sus 2 hijos pequeños. Cada día es de constante trabajo para esta empeñosa mujer, pues debe despertarse desde muy temprano para atender a sus hijos; y después dedicarse a su negocio que esta instalado en la comodidad de su casa. Hace 7 años por consejo de una amiga empezó con la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y desde entonces, no ha parado de comercializar, nada ni nadie  ha sido impedimento para que todos los días se esfuerce por sacar adelante a su familia. Dice que con el tiempo ha conocido a mayor cantidad de clientes, y éstas a su vez le traen más compradoras lo que le permite obtener mayores ganancias. Por su gran esfuerzo y dedicación la marca para la que trabaja la nombró captadora de su zona, por lo que no solo recibe ganancias por sus ventas, sino también bonos y comisiones. Como siempre se proyecta a futuro, tiene pensado mejorar la cantidad de mercadería que actualmente ofrece en una vitrina en la sala de su casa. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y promete como siempre cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Dina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza, además de accesorios para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dina, 37, lives in a house that she owns with her husband, Manuel, 36, and their 2 young children. Every day is a work day for this tireless woman. She has to get up very early to care for her children so that she can then tend the business that she runs from her house. She started the business, selling beauty products, 7 years ago after a friend recommended it. She hasn't stopped working since and she hasn't allowed anyone or anything to keep her from making it a success and, in turn, providing her family with the extra income they need to get ahead. She says that, over time, she has built up an ever-larger base of customers who, in turn, bring in other customers, a process that allows her to grow her business and increase her earnings. Her hard work and the success she's had paid off when she was made the senior rep in her neighborhood, something that qualifies her for a greater income, bonuses, etc. Dina is always thinking ahead. She is considering increasing the quantity of goods that she displays in the space that she has set aside for the business. This is her sixth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time because she wants to continue working with the bank. In addition to the merchandise she has long sold, Dina is thiking of adding a wider range of related products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Rosslinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Rosslinda; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera y se dedica a la artesanía, ella trabajaba anteriormente en la atención de la tienda abarrotes de su familia y ahora trabaja con artesanía, ella vende en esta tienda ubicada en Pisac, vende ponchos, y diferentes tejidos hechos en lana de ovino. La socia solicita el dinero para ayudar a su madre e implementar su tienda abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda abarrotes de su madre e implementarla. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosslinda, 26, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE LA O” communal bank located in Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She’s single and is a craftsperson. She used to work tending to her family’s grocery store but she now works in crafts. She sells ponchos and various woolens made with sheep’s wool in a store located in Pisac. She asked for money to help her mother stock her grocery store. She will invest the loan in her mother’s grocery store. She is grateful to all those who form part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her mother's store.

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN D. LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella tiene unos terrenos y también tiene como actividad la agricultura en las épocas D. siembra y cosecha, La socia trabaja vendiendo todo tipo D. artesanía, desD. piedras exóticas, cuarzos, bisutería, tejidos, bordados y demás. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería como hilos D. colores, cuarzos y alambres D. alpaca para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Higidia, 56, is a member of the “VIRGEN D. LA O” communal bank located in Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She is married and has four children. She is a craftsperson and also engages in farming during planting and harvest time. She works selling all kinds of crafts like: exotic stones, quartz, jewelry, weavings, embroidery, etc. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise for her business, like colored thread, quartz and silver wires. She takes this opportunity to thank all those who participate in this dream through this medium and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business (colored thread, silver wire, quartz)

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella tiene su negocio de venta de aretes en alpaca y venta de carteras tejidas en ovino; La socia compra al por mayor estas carteras que vienen con sus monederos interiores en el mismo tejido y color que la cartera, algunas traen un monedero mediano y otro chico para el sencillo. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la siguiente temporada. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Teodora, 51, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE LA O” communal bank located in Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She is married and has 6 children. She is a craftsperson and sells earrings made of Alpaca and sheep’s wool woven purses. She buys the purses, that include a coin purse inside made of the same color wool as the purse, at wholesale; some have a medium size coin purse and others a small one for small change. She needs funds to buy merchandise for the upcoming season. She needs the loan to buy merchandise for her business. She takes this opportunity to use this forum to thank all those who participate in this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Tomasa Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito D. Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa Agripina; ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es casada y  tiene 5 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz), y también es propietaria D. un bar picantería que trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos.la socia quiere ampliar su bar picantería y mejorar el servicio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocina  y para comprar maíz para hacer la chicha.

  La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tomasa Agripina, 62, is a member of the “VIRGEN D. LA O” communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has 5 children. She combines her daily household chores with chicha sales (a drink maD. from corn). She also owns a pub that’s open from 8am until 6pm. Her husband is a cattleman and together they are providing for their children. She’d like to enlarge her pub and improve service. She is asking for a loan to buy kitchen supplies and corn to make chicha. She uses this forum to thank all those who are part of this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies and corn to make chicha (a drink made from fermented corn).

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su pequeño hijo Jesús de10 años, juntos habitan en una morada ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven le gusto el arte, es por eso que cuando tuvo que mantener a su pequeño hijo sola, no se le ocurrió mejor idea que fabricar artesanías en vidrio. Y hace 1 año instaló su puesto de venta de todo tipo de artesanías en un mercado, en una zona bastante comercial de la ciudad, visitado por turistas;  y comparte su labor de comercialización junto a una ayudante, y así  se turnan en los horarios de atención. Dice con mucho orgullo, que atiende su negocio de lunes a viernes y durante los fines de semana se dedica por completo a producir  las artesanías en vidrio, pues le gusta darle forma al vidrio, para luego pintarlo y acabar dándole forma para que adornen las salas de diferentes partes del mundo. La buena atención que proporciona a sus clientes, le genera ganancias, que le permiten criar a su hijo sin dificultad. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio ya que desea surtirlo con diversidad de mercadería para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar a todas las personas que depositaron su confianza, al otorgarle el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando. Dora tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en variada artesanía que necesita para surtir mejor su tienda y así ofrecer lo mejor a los turistas que la visitan seguido.
texts.en:
Dora, 39, lives in her own house with her 10-year-old son Jesús. They live in a dwelling located in a populous neighborhod north of the city. From an early age she liked art, which is why when she had to support her young son alone, she could not think of a better idea than making glass handicrafts. A year ago, Dora set up her stall selling all kinds of crafts in a market in a very commercial area of the city visited by tourists. She shares the work of managing the stall with an assistant so that they can take turns opening up shop. She says proudly that her stall is open for business from Monday to Friday, and weekends are devoted entirely to producing glass handicrafts. Dora enjoys shaping the glass, painting it, and finishing shaping it to produce a product that decorates rooms around the world. Her excellent customer service skills generate a good income, which allows her to raise her child without difficulty. Because Dora is such an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her business by stocking her stall with a variety of merchandise in order to offer the best to her customers. This is her first loan with Kiva Partner MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time so as not to disappoint all the people who have put their trust in her. Dora plans to invest the requested loan in buying more merchandise of varied crafts to better stock her store and offer the best to the tourists who often visit it.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more handmade crafts to improve her business

loans.name: Erineo

texts.es:
Erineo tiene 61 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Rafael de Oriente, Departamento de San Miguel, Es casado, Vive con la esposa y dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 20 años, El se dedica a la agricultura.
Desde hace 45 años el trabaja la tierra, sus padres le inculcaron el trabajo cuando él era muy pequeño, sus padres ya murieron pero él le gusta mucho cultivar maíz  y frijoles, el actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas  como es fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Esto contribuirá a mejorar el cultivo y obtener una buena siembra que les servirá para la alimentación de la familia.
Las aspiraciones de Erineo son continuar cultivando la tierra para sacar adelante a la familia  y que no les haga falta el sustento diario de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia
texts.en:
Erineo is 61 years old and lives in the Municipality of San Rafael Oriente, Department of San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 15 and 20. For 45 years, Erineo has worked in agriculture. His parents instilled in him a love of working the land when he was very young. They have since passed away, but he continues to enjoy cultivating corn and beans. Erineo is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer to cultivate corn and bean crops. This will help him to improve the crop and obtain good seeds to feed his family. Erineo’s aspirations are to continue cultivating the land in order to provide food for his family and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate corn and bean crops

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Señor Pablo C. O. tiene 25 años es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en los chacos con las que su familia cuenta, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 4 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

El Sr. Pablo C., es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, pero ha sufrido mucho por la enfermedad que padece su hijo de 8 años, sufre de alergias a las picaduras de los insectos que abundan en el lugar donde vive, y ellos no cuentan con muchos recursos para poder someterlo a tratamientos, solo toma algunos antialérgicos que son paliativos. 

El Sr. Pablo C. solicita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, para poder realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia, y generar mas ingresos que le permitirán adquirir los medicamentos que requiere su hijo.
Cabe señalar que el señor Pablo C. O. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo C. O. is 25 years old, single, and has one son. From an early age he began working in the farmlands where his family lives. He currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the “2 de Agosto” union, where he has been an active member for four years. The taxi service is profitable because many people use it for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service. Pablo is a very responsible and enterprising person, but he has suffered greatly from allergic reactions from insect bites. His 8-year-old son also suffers from these allergic reactions. Insects abound in the place where he lives and they do not have many resources to treat the allergies. They can only take some antihistamine medications that only provide temporary relief. Pablo is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to be able to work more efficiently and generate more income to buy the medications necessary for his child. Mr. Pablo C. O. came in person to CIDRE's offices to ask for a loan after his coworkers told him of the institution's good credit conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 28 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus 2 hijas gemelas, ambas de 5 años, juntas y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan una humilde  morada ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Recuerda como empezó su negocio de comercialización de productos de aceites y  refrigerantes para autos, cuando vendía al por mayor, antes compraba estos productos en grandes bidones y los vendía al por menor a sus habituales clientes. Pero desde hace 4 años vende sus productos al por menor cada y dice que así gana regulares ganancias. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, pues lo realiza con personas conocidas, así asegura que le puedan cumplir con el pago, ya que vende sus productos a crédito. Además le gusta bastante su trabajo porque le permite generarse buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para  brindarles lo mejor a sus hijas; y como es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de mercadería, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos que le compran sus productos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en aceites y refrigerantes para autos que le hacen falta para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
28 year old Juana lives in a rented house with her two twin daughters, who are 5 years old. They are eager to improve their situation. They live in a humble dwelling located in a very crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. She remembers how she started her business marketing engine oil and coolants for cars, which were sold wholesale. She used to buy these products in large drums and sold them at retail price to regular customers. But, for the past 4 years she has sold individual retail goods and says that in this way she can earn a regular income. At the same time as running this business, she also sells beauty products from a catalog. She sells to people that she knows as the products are sold on credit and she needs to be sure she can always make the payments. She likes her work because it brings in good income and makes it possible for her to give the best to her daughters. As she is a woman who is eager to get ahead, she has plans to increase the amount of merchandise she carries, as she has regular customers who buy her products. This is the first loan she has had from MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually. In addition, she does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible and are helping her to keep working. Juana plans to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of oils and coolants for cars, as she that she can offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock-up on oil and other products for vehicles.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de 2 de sus 5 hijos, pues el resto son mayores e independientes, pues hace algún tiempo se separó de su conviviente. Desde muy joven esta luchadora mujer se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes oficios, y en la actualidad vende salchipapas (platillo compuesto de papas y hot dog fritos) que ofrece en un carrito especial para frituras. El día empieza desde muy temprano cuando se dirige al mercado en busca de los ingredientes básicos para preparar sus platillos, y ya en la tarde prepara lo que venderá en la noche. Llegada la noche empieza con su trabajo, ofreciendo a sus clientes este rico platillo, a veces el horario de atención se prolonga pasada la medianoche, pero ella dice que la recompensa a su esmerada labor son las regulares ganancias que obtiene de las ventas diarias, pues tiene clientes fijos que gustan de lo que prepara. Paralelamente a esta labor también brinda el servicio de limpieza y cocina para una familia que la contrata por temporadas. Como es una mujer con muchos planes en mente para mas adelante tiene pensado ampliar su negocio y mejorarlo para satisfacción de sus clientes. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Liz tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de ingredientes para abastecer su negocio y continuar cocinando para ofrecer lo mejor a sus asiduos comensales.
texts.en:
37 year old Liz lives in her own house with 2 of her 5 children, the rest are older and live independently. She has been separated from her former partner for some time. Since she was very young, this hardworking woman has worked in a variety of roles, and she currently sells salchipapas (a fried dish made from potatoes and hot dog sausage) from a special fried-food cart. Her day starts very early when she goes to the market in search of the basic ingredients for making her dishes, and in the afternoon she prepares the food she will sell in the evening. When the evening comes, she starts her work selling her customers this tasty meal, and she sometimes stays open until after midnight. But, she says that the reward for this diligent work is the income that she gets from selling her meals daily, and she has regular clients who enjoy the food that she makes. At the same time as this work, she also offers a cleaning and cooking service to a family that employs her off and on. As she is a woman with many plans in mind for getting ahead, she is thinking of growing her business and improving customer satisfaction. This is the first loan she has had from MFP, and she is very grateful to all the people who are making it possible and helping her to keep working and seeking progress. Liz plans to use the loan to buy ingredients to stock her business and continue cooking in order to provide the best to her regular diners.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Orión (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Macarena V. Guzmán, vive en Tecpatan Estado  de Chiapas México.es madre soltera con dos hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad, Roberto Mario de once años, le dicen (tito), la otra es linda patricia (pati) de seis años de edad y la bebe que esta por nacer en unos meses el cual será niña y está ansiosa de tenerla en sus brazos.

  Ella es maestra de primaria desde hace once años en una comunidad  que se llama madero y está retirado de su localidad, pero aun así le va bien y ha sacado adelante a su familia, ya que la gente lo trata bien por el servicio que le das a sus alumnos y no quieren que por ningún motivo ella salga de su trabajo por ser muy buena persona.

  Comenta que solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para su taller manualidades como son: hilos. Argollas, madera y agujas. Para la elaboración de hamacas, bolsas, cuadros de paisajes, y mecedora. Tiene trabajando esta actividad hace diez meses y dice que le va bien ya que sus clientes le compran  al mayoreo y también se los da a facilidad de pago.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta compra más material a si tenga como elaborar sus manualidades y cada día tenga mejores ingresos para que con eso pueda pagar el préstamo que solicito en fundación realidad y tenga mejores oportunidades de trabajar con  el crédito.

  Lo que quiere es poder a horrar para que con el tiempo logre construir una casa más amplia para que sus hijos vivan cómodos, como también tener una papelería  donde venda artículos de mejor calidad , así sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y buen futuro. 

  Macarena formo parte del grupo ya que la invito una amiga la señora Flor  Delva quien es representante del grupo a participar en el préstamo ya que tiene facilidad de pago y es menos el interés, se animo y fue así como ella se integro. El grupo se llama orión la razón del nombre es por que donde ella trabaja ay un callejón que lo nombran de esa manera.

 Las personas que integran en el grupo son cuatro señoras y cada una con diferente actividad son la siguiente:

 Macarena V. Guzmán: invierte el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de manualidades como son: hamacas, mecedoras, cuadros y bolsas.

 Flor Delva Guzmán L.: invierte el préstamo para compra y venta de zapato, sandalias y bolsas para  dama.
 María Elidía M. Jiménez: utilizara el préstamo para la compra de catálogos para vender zapatos de marca como son: impulso y maga shoes.
 Adalea V. Guzmán: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catalogo de fuller, jafra y blondy, para vender perfumes  desodorantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Macarena lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother with 2 children who are reliant on her: 11 year-old Roberto Mario, who they call Tito, and Linda Patricia (Pati), who is 6. And the baby who will be born in a few months will be a girl, and she is eager to hold her in her arms. She has been an elementary school teacher for 11 years. She teaches in a community called Madero, which is some distance from where she lives. But she is still doing well and has been able to help her family get ahead. People treat her well thanks to the service that she gives to her students and they don't want her to leave her work for any reason because she is a good person. She says that she requested a loan to buy materials for her craft production, being: thread, rings, wood, and needles to make hammocks, bags, landscape pictures, and swings. She has been doing this work for 10 months and says that it is going well as her customers buy in bulk and she gives them payment schemes. With the income that she makes from her sales, she buys more material so she can make more crafts, and every day she has more income and will be able to repay the loan that she is requesting from Fundacíon Realidad and the loan will give her better work opportunities. She wants to be able to save so that in time she can build a larger house and make her children comfortable. She also wants to have a stationary store where she can sell high-quality goods. She wants this so her children can have a good education and good future. Macarena became part of the group when her friend, Flor Delva, who is the group's representative for the loan, invited her. She was interested because the loan payments are easy and the interest is low, so she joined. The group is called "Orión" because where they work there is a street of that name. There are 4 women in the group and each has a different business, being: Macarena will use the loan to buy materials to make crafts such as hammocks, swings, pictures, and bags. Flor Delva will use the loan to buy and sell shoes, sandals, and women's bags. María Elidía will use the loan to buy catalogs to sell shoes from the Impulso and Maga brands. Adalia will use the loan to buy catalogs from Fuller, Jafra, and Blondy to sell perfumes, deodorants, and other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de hamacas, cuadros, mecedoras entre otros.

loans.name: Tlatoani Group

texts.es:
Este Grupo solidario se llama Tlatoani, esta ubicado en Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos, esta conformado por 4 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinos y están muy contentos con el préstamo que le proporcionan.
Los integrantes del grupo son el señor Eutimio Gómez T. va a comprar con su préstamo madera (polines), tablas, etc. para tener madera para cimbrar el es albañil, el señor Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez va a comprar hojas para tamal, carne, chiles secos, leche, canela, azúcar, arroz para elaborar sus tamales y su atole, la señora Antolina Cornelio X. F. va a comprar catálogos nuevos para surtirse de blancos, colchas, sabanas matrimoniales e individuales, la señora Maria Elena O. M. va a comprar una parrilla, mesas, y mercancía elotes por bulto, queso por kilo, chile en polvo por kilo para preparar sus elotes, esquites y chile atole.
El señor Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez es el representante del grupo, tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, vive en unión Libre tiene 1 hija de 6 años de edad se llama Anel y estudia la primaria, el señor Humberto solicito su préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de atole y tamales va a comprar Hojas para tamal, manteca, carne, vasos, cucharas, servilletas, papel extraza, azúcar, chiles guagillo, masa, leche, canela, arroz, inicio su negocio hace 20 años por necesidades económicas por que en el campo no había trabajo, trabajaba 1 día o dos días de la semana y se le ocurrió comenzar a vender atole y tamales, le va muy bien en el negocio, inicio vendiendo su producto en cubetas, caminando fue ahorrando y compro su triciclo donde se desplaza mas fácilmente en todo el pueblo, en la gasolinera, en la orilla de la carretera donde va ofreciendo sus tamales y atole, sus clientes son todas la personas del pueblo y los turistas que se detienen a comprar ornatos de barro y alfarería, el  se siente orgulloso de tener este negocio por que le a permitido comprar su terreno donde esta viviendo y esta construyendo su casa de material,  su casa donde vive es de madera y techo de lamina pero están ahorrando para poner las bardas de tabique y el techo de concreto, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de otros compañeros que venden los mismos productos. Las ganancia que obtiene las reparte en los gastos de la familia, en mampostería de la casa e invirtiendo en los insumos para volver a vender el atole y los tamales. Lo que mas le ha gusta es cuando vende y recibe el dinero, es importante por que de ahí comen y es el sostén de la familia. Sus sueños son hacer su casa verla terminada y bonita también que su hija siga estudiando para que tenga su carrera y un buen empleo. El esta feliz y contento, lleno de salud con el préstamo que le proporcionan  y quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas Gracias que confían en nosotros y que nos sigan prestando” 
En el Pueblo de Tlayacapan hay mucha tranquilidad, todos se conoce y son muy amistosos, es turístico venden productos de alfareria, esta muy bonito esta verde, tiene historia mágica por su cerros que se llaman el sombrerito, mariposa, la ventanilla, la iglesia es exconvento, también es la cuna de los chinelos, en el mes de Febrero o marzo 5 días antes del miércoles de ceniza, hay fiesta en el pueblo desde el viernes al martes.
texts.en:
This group is named Tlatoani and it is located in Tlayacapan in the state of Morelos. It is made up of 4 members. They all know each other and are neighbors. They are all very happy for the loan they have requested. Eutimio G. Torrez will purchase wood and wood planks with his loan to use in his work. He is a construction worker. Humberto Eduardo M. R. will purchase corn husks, meat, dried chilies, milk, sugar, cinnamon and rice to make tamales and warm corn flour drinks. Antolina Cornelio X. F. will purchase new catalogues to restock her business with linen and blankets in various sizes. Maria Elena O. M. will purchase a grill, chairs, sacks of corn on the cob, cheeses, powdered chili for the corn, and for corn drink. Humberto Eduardo M. R. is the representative of the group. He is 40 years old and he has a grade 9 education. He lives together with his wife and their 6-year old daughter named Anel. She attends primary school. Humberto requests a loan to invest in his business, selling corn flour drinks and tamales. He will use it to purchase corn husks, lard, meats, cups, spoons, napkins, sugar, chilies, corn flour, milk, cinnamon and rice. He started his business 20 years ago for the lack of paid work. He used to work one or two days a week so he started selling corn drinks and tamales. His business has been very successful. He started out selling his products from buckets but with time he started to save money and he purchased an adult tricycle which helped him to go all over town. He goes to gas stations and along the streets to sell his corn drinks and tamales. He sells to the entire population of the village and to tourists that stop to purchase ornate clay objects and pottery. He is proud of his business because with it he has been able to purchase a plot of land where he lives and where he is building a house. The house where he lives is made of wood and aluminum sheeting, but he is saving money to make the walls out of bricks and the roof of concrete. He faces competition from others that work in the same business, selling the same products. He invests his earnings in part to cover the family’s expenses, in part to continue building their house, and he also invests a part of his earnings back into the business. What he enjoys most of his work is completing a sale. It is very important because it feeds and supports his family. His dreams are to see his house completed and beautiful. He also wishes to see his daughter attend school and achieve a career and a have a good job. He is very happy and content and in good health. He is glad about the loan he is granted he wishes to thank Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for the trust imparted to them by this loan and future loans. The village of Tlayacapan is quiet and clam and every one knows the members of the group. The region is very friendly and it is known by tourists for its clay pottery. It is a lovely village where everything is green with vegetation and there is a magical history of the surrounding mountains, commonly known as The Little Sombrero, Butterfly, and The Little Window. The church was once a convent. It is also the birthplace of chinelos, colorfully dressed dancers. In the months of February and March up to 5 days before Ash Wednesday there are weekly fairs, on Friday to Tuesday every week.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn husks, lard, meats, cups, spoons, napkins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: Mirtha, de 51 años, vive en su casa que es propia, que esta hecha de material noble, en compañía de su esposo Sergio de 53 años y de su joven hija Mayra de 18 años, pues sus otros 5 hijos son mayores e independientes. Desde que se unió con su esposo pensó en instalar un negocio, y con el paso del tiempo decidió empezar con la venta de diferentes comestibles en su casa. Luego de un tiempo el pequeño negocio creció y ahora tiene en toda la esquina de su casa una surtida bodega, pues ofrece variados comestibles y gaseosas. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, pues no sale de su casa, y además cuenta con la ayuda de su joven hija quien atiende  durante sus ratos libres, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una dama muy trabajadora, también se dedica al bordado de pedrería en prendas de vestir, y para lograrlo trabaja durante las mañanas en esta labor, pero trabaja con un intermediario, que le deja las prendas y después las recoge cuando el trabajo esta terminado. Además para el futuro tiene planeado surtir mejor su tienda de comestibles y comprar nuevos estantes para exhibir de la mejor manera sus productos.  Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ya que no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mirtha tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en comestibles y gaseosas para surtir mejor su tienda, y además destinará una parte en la compra de mostacillas y lentejuelas (pedrería) que le hace falta para terminar de elaborar unas prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 51, she owns a house made of good material and lives there with her husband Sergio, 53 and their daughter Mayra 18, her other five children are older and independent. When she got married she thought of starting a business and as time went by she decided to sell groceries from her home. After a while the small business grew and now she has a whole area of the house a well stocked store where she offers groceries and soda. She says work is calm because she doesn’t leave the house and she also has the help of her daughter that works at the store in her free time, this way she helps her husband with the home expenses. Because she is a hardworking lady she also works doing hand beading on clothing, which she does during the mornings, she works with a third party that drops of the clothing to be beaded and picks it up when the beading is finished. For the future, she plans to stock her store with more food and buy new shelves to show the products better. This is the sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people that made the loan possible and that will allow her to work in search of progress. Mirtha plans to invest the loan requested in buying food and pop to stock her store better, part of the loan will also be used to buy beads to finish working on some clothes she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with various products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Marco de 37 años, que es transportista, y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales el primero trabaja y se mantiene, pues ya es mayor de edad. Desde hace 4 meses trabaja prestando servicio de  seguridad en las calles, dice que ha sido contratada por la municipalidad de su distrito, y  junto a otras mujeres demuestra cada día que ellas pueden velar por la seguridad ciudadana con mucha dedicación. Le gusta este trabajo porque le permite obtener ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, además se puede comprar sus gustos de vez en cuando. Lo que no le gusta es que sus compañeros varones duden de su buen desempeño, aunque asegura que luego de estos meses les ha demostrado que hay igualdad de género. En adelante, luego de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, quiere instalar cabinas para ofrecer el servicio de Internet, para ello se asociara con su esposo. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Nancy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su casa, pues para el futuro tiene planeado instalar en ese lugar un negocio, así espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Nancy is 37, lives at home with her husband Marco, also 37, he is a driver, she also lives with her three children, the oldest one works and supports himself as he is an adult. Four months ago she started working providing security service on the streets, she was hired by the municipality of the district and along with other women, she demonstrates every day that women can look after the security of the citizens with much dedication. She likes her job because it allows her to make income to help her husband in the constant home expenses, she can also buy herself something once in a while. What she doesn't like is that her male co-workers doubt of her good performance, she assures that after these months she has demonstrated that there is gender equality. Later on, after improving the infrastructure of her house, she wants to install cabins to offer Internet service, and she will work together with her husband. This is the first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time and this way not betray the trust given to her by all the people that made possible the loan that will allow her to keep working. Nancy has planned to invest the loan in buying building materials for the betterment of her house infrastructure, so that she can start a business in the future and achieve progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve house insfrastructure to start a business.

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala S. is 42 and married with six children aged between two and eighteen. Ala owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years' experience in this business. Ala needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Ala joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Ala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a tank of cooking gas for her hamburger selling business

loans.name: Taitai

texts.en:
Taitai L. is 33, married, and has two children aged two and six. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Taitai has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST) to improve and expand her business.
Taitai joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Taitai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi L. is 45, married, and has three children aged from six to sixteen. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Lotoi has two years' experience in this business. Lotoi is requesting a loan of 1,250 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Lotoi joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Lotoi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, reside en el municipio de San Rafael Oriente en San Miguel, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de un año de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura. El aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que sus padres le enseñaron y él lo desarrolla desde hace siete años para el sustento de su familia. El en este momento está solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizara para la siembra de Maíz y Frijol comprando los insumos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha como lo es el abono. Este contribuirá para obtener una mejor producción de granos básicos, mejorando las condiciones de vida de esta familia.
Don Carlos aspira continuar trabajando la tierra, apoyar a sus hijos con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the municipality of San Rafael Oriente in San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife, and they have a 1 year-old son. He is a farmer. He learned to work the land because his parents taught him; he has been doing this work for 7 years to support his family. Now he is requesting a loan that he will use to plant corn and beans, buying the supplies he needs to obtain a good harvest, like fertilizer. This will help him to increase his production of basic grains, improving the conditions of life for his family. Carlos wants to continue working the land, to support his children with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate corn and beans

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina, de 44 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Santos de 44 años, y de sus 2 hijos menores, juntos habitan en un barrio populoso al norte de la ciudad. Esta emprendedora mujer esta acostumbrada al trabajo, es por eso que desde hace 1 año se dedica en la venta de ropa. La modalidad de su comercio es la siguiente: compra diferente variedad de ropa, tanto para damas y caballeros; luego la traslada al norte del país donde la deja a sus familiares, quienes a su vez la venden finalmente  a sus amigos y conocidos. Dice que es una actividad bastante rentable, aunque el capital se demora algunos meses en moverse; y además le gusta porque le permite viajar, de esta manera puede visitar a sus familiares de vez en cuando. Paralelamente a esta actividad  también se dedica a la siembra de arroz en el norte del país, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de sus hermanos, quienes realizan toda la labor y luego se reparten el dinero con ella, quien es la dueña de éstas tierras. Así son los días de esta esforzada mujer que siempre esta en busca del progreso; y para mas adelante se proyecta a mejorar la cantidad de ropa que comercializa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con su labor. Agustina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en ropa, de esta manera espera ofrecer lo mejor a sus compradores y generarse mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Agustina, 44, lives in her own home with her husband Santos, 44, and their 2 minor children. They live together in a populated neighborhood in the northern part of the city. This enterprising woman is used to work; she has been selling clothing for a year. She runs her business in the following way: she buys a variety of clothing, for women as well as men, and later travels to the northern part of the country where she leaves the clothing with her relatives, who in turn finally sell the clothing to their friends and acquaintances. She says that this activity is very profitable, although it takes a few months to recoup the capital. In addition, she likes it because it allows her to travel, and in this way she is able to visit her relatives from time to time. In addition to this activity, she also cultivates rice in the northern part of the country. She does this with the help of her brothers, who do all of the labor and later share the money with her since she owns the land. That's how the days go for this dedicated woman, who is always seeking progress. For the future, she plans to increase the quantity of the clothing that she sells. This is the second time that she has taken a loan from MFP, and she pledges to be punctual with her payments, because she doesn't want to disappoint the people who have made this loan possible and have allowed her to continue with her work. Agustina plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of a larger quantity of clothing. In this way she hopes to offer the best to her customers and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Shirley Maria

texts.es: Shirley S. en Los Calamares, un barrio de la ciudad de Cartagena, vende conservas a base de leche, negocio que inició en compañía de su padre, cuando comercializaba pequeñas cantidades que ofrecía de tienda en tienda y en otros negocios; así logró la aceptación de la comunidad  y concretar muchos clientes, hasta convertirse en proveedores de grandes negocios en la ciudad de Cartagena y también en Turbaco, pueblo muy cerca a esta ciudad;  este negocio ha sido importante para su vida y la de su familia, porque de él se ha derivado el sustento de ella;  por eso sus esfuerzos están dirigidos a que su negocio crezca, se fortalezca y se formalice para algún día poder exportar este producto que es el gran sueño de su vida. Shirley cuenta que aunque el mercado de los dulces en Cartagena es bastante competido,  la calidad reflejada en la higiene, la pureza de sus ingredientes hace que su negocio sea una microempresa sostenible. Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  lo requiere porque va a comprar en mayor volumen los ingredientes que utiliza para su elaboración, como leche y azúcar, porque ella sabe que como mujer joven, si ella persiste en cumplir sus metas, finalmente conseguirá en un futuro que sus conservas sean apetecidas en muchas partes del mundo.
texts.en:
Shirley S. sells milk-based sweets in Cartagena’s Los Calamares neighborhood. She started the business with her father selling small amounts from store to store and to other businesses. Thus she gained acceptance in the community and acquired many customers until she became a supplier to large businesses in Cartagena and Turbaco, a nearby city. This business has been important for her and her family’s lives because from it they have supported themselves. Her efforts, therefore, are directed towards its growth so that it will strengthen and formalize so that one day the product may be exported; this is the big dream she has. Shirley tells us that even though the sweets business in Cartagena is quite competitive the quality that’s reflected in the sanitation standards and the purity of her ingredients make her firm a sustainable micro business. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she needs it to buy a larger amount of ingredients that she uses to elaborate the product, like milk and sugar, because she knows that as a young woman, if she persists in meeting her goals, in the end she will secure a future in which her sweets are savored in many parts of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of ingredients like milk and sugar.

loans.name: Julia Silvania

texts.es:
Julia de 54 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierras y montañas.     

Tiene 21 años con su papelería para solventar los gastos familiares ya que es viuda y poder pasar tiempo con sus dos hijos. comenzó a vender papelería en su casa a sus vecinos, poco a poco construyo la parte delantera de su casa en un local. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am. 

Pero para continuar trabajando en su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo una papelería. En el futuro quiere ampliar mas su negocio para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia , 54, has a paper goods store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved, hilly streets. She’s had the store for 21 years to help meet family expenses since she’s a widow and wants to be able to spend time with her two children. She started out selling paper goods from home to her neighbors and gradually built a space for it in the front part of her house; she opens for business at 8am. To continue working she needs a loan to buy stock items. In the future she’d like to expand her business still more to insure a good future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stationery items, notebooks.

loans.name: Sauniatu

texts.en:
Sauniatu L. is 25 and married with no children. She owns a business venture raising pigs for sale. Sauniatu has two years' experience in this business. Sauniatu needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Sauniatu joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Sauniatu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 37 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Primitivo de 38 años, que trabaja en instalación de cables y también con sus 2 hijos menores. Desde hace 1 año se asoció con una amiga en el negocio de crianza y venta de pollos. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, ya que solo deben brindar lo necesario para que los polluelos crezcan sin dificultad y así después de un mes los venden a buenos precios a sus amigos y conocidos, que los requieren para consumo o para comercializarlos. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces los pollos enferman debido a que son bastante delicados; pero lo que le agrada es que crecen con rapidez, de esta manera puede obtener ganancias con regular frecuencia. Dice que es un negocio bastante rentable, ya que las rentas  le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora, en adelante tiene planeado ampliar este negocio, y para esto quiere, junto con su amiga, comprar un terreno para aumentar la cantidad de polluelos y criarlos con mayor espacio. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Graciela tiene planeado invertir  el crédito solicitado en la compra de alimento y engorde para los pollos, y de esta manera espera que crezcan con mayor rapidez, para después comercializarlos y generarse buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
37 year old Graciela lives with her husband, 38 year old Primitivo, who installs cables, and their 2 small children. For the past year she has worked with a friend raising and selling chickens. She says that the work is straightforward as they only have to provide what is necessary for the chickens to grow without difficulty and then, after one month, they sell them at a good price to their friends and acquaintances, who need them for food or to sell. She doesn't like that the chickens often become sick because they are quite delicate, but she is pleased that they grow quickly and so they can get regular income. She says that this business is quite profitable and the income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to grow the business and for this she and her friend need to buy some land to increase the number of chickens they can keep and raise them in more space. This is the second loan that she has had from MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually so as to not disappoint all the people who have made the loan possible and are helping her to continue working. Graciela plans to use the loan to buy food and fatten-up the chickens, and so have them grow more quickly so they can sell them and generate good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania S. is 24, married, and has six children aged between two and eight. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Epifania has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Epifania joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Epifania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix Pedro H. es comerciante se dedica a la venta de carne bovina, el es casado vive en el sector rural del Municipio de Condega.

El solicita este crédito para la compra de carne al por mayor en un matadero de la capital para luego venderla al por menor a la población de Condega y sectores aledaños.

El comenzó aproximadamente hace 10 años vendiendo carne en poca cantidad  en la comunidad donde el vive a medida que la demanda aumento el fue surtiendo mas el negocio. El se dedica a esta labor de lunes a sábado desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm, cabe señalar que este Sr. Antes de dedicarse a la venta de carne el trabajaba en un matadero local aquí en Condega donde adquirió la experiencias en los tipos de carne.

El espera que con este préstamo el logre aumentar su inventario y así poder obtener mayores ventas y por ende mayor ingresos de ganancias.

El sr Félix Pedro H. es casado  y tiene un hijo en edad escolar al que le toca sufragarle los gastos escolares y la esposa se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de barro.

Este es el crédito numero 11 que el tiene en nuestra institución desde en un lapso de tiempo de 6 años y se muestra agradecido con Ceprodel por los financiamientos brindado ya que el han ayudado a surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro H. is a beef merchant. He’s married and lives in the rural sector of Condega. He is asking for funds to buy meat from the slaughterhouse in the capital at wholesale for subsequent retail sales in Condega and surrounding sectors. He started selling small quantities of meat about 10 years ago in the community where he lives. As demand grew he stocked more. He works from Monday through Saturday from 7am until 5pm. It’s worth noting that before he started to sell meat he was employed by the local Condega slaughterhouse where he acquired a lot of experience regarding types of meat. He hopes that with the loan he will manage to increase his stock inventory thus obtaining better sales and consequently higher profits. Mr. Félix Pedro H. is married and has a school age son for whom he must pay all educational expenses. His wife makes clay handicrafts. This is his 11th loan with our institution in a period of 6 years. He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans granted that have helped him stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Fanuafou

texts.en:
Fanuafou V. is 28, married, and has two children aged six and eight. She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. Fanuafou has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Fanuafou joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Fanuafou's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tualupetu

texts.en:
Tualupetu L. is 48, married, and has six children aged between six and twenty-one. She owns a business venture providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Tualupetu has two years' experience in this business. Tualupetu is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Tualupetu joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Tualupetu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Martha Erling

texts.es:
La joven MARTHA ERLING T. E. es empleada en una fábrica de puros en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un préstamo en Ceprodel para la realización de un examen clínico que se realizara ya que ella esta enferma y para la compra del medicamento y así mejorar su salud  rendimiento.

Una ves que ella salió de su secundaria empezó a trabaja en dicha fabrica y así tener un ingreso familiar para su sostén diario del hogar. Ella tiene aproximadamente 8 años de laborar en dicha empresa, labora desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de los días lunes a los días viernes.

Ella espera que con este crédito logre realizarse dichos exámenes y así poder comprar el tratamiento ya que sus ingresos no le permites obtener por cuenta propia el dinero completo.

Ella es soltera y tiene una hija en edad escolar, la hija aun cursa los estudios de primaria y ella es la que sufraga los gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito numero  diez que ella solicita en un periodo de 7 años y su impacto ha sido positivo ya que dichos financiamiento le han permitido comprar algunos de los útiles del hogar que ella posee.
texts.en:
MARTHA ERLING T. E. is employed by a cigar factory in greater Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to pay for clinical tests that she’ll have done because she’s ill and to pay for medicines thus improving her health. When she finished secondary school she started working in the cigar factory in order to earn family income to contribute to the daily support of the household. She has been working in that firm for about 8 years. She works from 7am until 5pm Monday through Friday. She hopes the loan will make the lab tests possible so that she can buy the treatment she needs because her income is insufficient by itself to afford the total cost. She is single and has a school age daughter. Her daughter is still in elementary school and she must cover all her educational expenses. This is the 10th loan she’s had in a span of 7 years. The impact has been positive since the loans have made it possible for her to buy some of the household utensils she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines and pay for an examination.

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier Q. B., tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 2 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer producir los cultivos de la finca (hortalizas), la idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Didier cuenta con área tiene diversos cultivos como: culantro, lechuga, rábano, apio, entre otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Didier también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Didier Q. B., 29, is married and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son. He needs the loan to buy supplies to help his vegetable crops grow. The idea is to improve and enlarge production capacity and to expand the planted area. Didier has space for several kinds of crops: coriander, lettuce, radish and celery, among others. He wants to provide his crops with proper care and maintenance to obtain the best quality so that when he sells his crops he’ll get the best possible price for them. This is the first time he’s negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms he was offered. He has been a farmer for several years. He hopes to improve his quality of life in the future and to have better economic stability in order to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Girasoles” consists of 18 associates from the city of San Bernardo. These individual's livelihoods consist of sales including: confectionery, lingerie, chocolate, curtains, hair accessories, eggs, beans, sausages, china plates, jewelry, various fast foods and sweets.
Olga (pictured in the second row, with a blue jacket and ginger hair) is the president of this group. She operates a fast-food business (selling completos – the traditional Chilean hotdog, churrascos – lean steak sandwich, pizzas, empandadas, French fries y sopaipillas – fried dough, etc.) and drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). Olga also caters for club de rayuela (a typical Chilean game) gatherings. Olga and her husband have been catering for these types of gatherings for the past three years from Thursday through Sunday.
Olga will invest her loan in merchandise and various food products and drinks for her business. Prior to running her fast-food establishment, Olga was selling clothes and Avon products as well as producing chocolates and her own embroidered curtains. Olga has three children, two grown men (20 and 16) and an 11-year-old daughter.
Olga’s goal is to finish paying her bank loan. She is motivated to work as this will not only increase her earnings but lift her spirits. Olga is also saving to refurbish her son's computer as it is no longer working. Olga enjoys working with Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, as the payment schedules are weekly and this helps her get out of debt swiftly. Olga has also benefited from the entrepreneurship sessions as she now knows how to invest her earnings and price her products. San Bernardo is a city located 18km directly south of the Main Plaza of Santiago (the capital of Chile). San Bernardo’s population is mostly middle to low income workers who live in residential neighborhoods.The economy is based mainly on trade. The city also contains places of public recreation such as gyms, social clubs, restaurants, soda fountains and tea rooms.

loans.use: To purchase various food and drink products for her business

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta, de 51 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Jorge de 70 años y de sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores, juntos habitan una morada ubicada al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven le gustó trabajar, es por eso que se ha dedicado al comercio toda su vida. Y hace 6 años vende productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, dice que el negocio es bastante tranquilo, pues ofrece los productos por catalogo a sus conocidas y amigas, luego les trae los pedidos y se los ofrece a crédito. Esta muy satisfecha porque puede trabajar desde su casa, gana regular dinero, de esta manera no descuida las labores de su hogar, afirma que no le gusta vender a personas desconocidas, pues desconfía que le puedan pagar a tiempo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y comprar una vitrina para surtirla con mejores productos y accesorios para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere defraudar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Antonieta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza pues quiere mejorar su stock y así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 51, lives in her own house, located in the north of the city, with her husband, Jorge, 70, and their two adult children. She has enjoyed working from a very young age; she has been involved in commerce her entire life. For the last 6 years she has sold beauty products of a world renowned brand. She says the business is quite tranquil because she offers the goods via catalogue to her acquaintances and friends and then brings them their fulfilled orders which she offers on credit. She is very satisfied because she can work from home; she earns steady income without neglecting her household chores. She states that she doesn’t particularly like to sell to people who are unknown to her because she fears they may not pay on time. Because she’s a very enterprising woman later on she’d like to expand her beauty products sales business and buy a display case to stock it with the best products and accessories to offer her customers. This is the first loan she’s had with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people who made the financing that will allow her to continue to work possible. Antonieta plans to use the money to buy a larger amount of beauty products because she wants to improve her stock thus improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on beauty supplies.

loans.name: Vaine

texts.en:
Vaine A. is 37, married, and has five children aged from two to twelve. She owns a business venture providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Vaine has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Vaine joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Vaine's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María A. G., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos. Ellos tienen 19,15,14,11 y 5 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos de engorde. La idea es criar los pollos de engorde, aumentar la cantidad para luego venderlos a otros clientes, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Ella cuenta  con un local para el desarrollo y engorde de los pollos.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Ana María desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Ana María A. G., 38, is married and has 5 children: aged 19,15,14,11 and 5 years. She wants a loan to purchase broiler chickens. The idea is that she will raise broiler chickens and breed them, later selling them to her customers. This way she will have the highest possible income when she sells them. She has a place where she can raise the chickens. This is the first time that she has taken a loan from FUDECOSUR, and she is very pleased with the ease of payments that they offer. Ana Maria hopes that this business will help her to provide economic support to her household. In the future she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens

loans.name: Nelvis Ariel

texts.es:
El Sr. NELVIS ARIEL O. C. reside en el municipio de Condega, el se dedica  a la elaboración de puros en una fabrica en el sector urbano de este municipio

El solicita un crédito que será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, bloques, madera, etc. Para mejorar sus vivienda y tener un mejor techo donde vivir.

El empezó a atrabajar en dicha fabrica en la elaboración de puros desde hace unos cinco años, el trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm. Cabe señalar que antes de dedicarse a esta labor este sr, estaba estudiando en secundaria.

El espera que con la compra de estos materiales el pueda reparar su casa de habitación y vivir mas tranquilo y aun mas en las épocas de lluvia y darle un techo signo a su esposa.

El es casado y vive solo en su casa de habitación con su esposa aun no tiene hijos.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que el solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de 4 años, y argumenta que el impacto de estos prestamos han sido satisfactorio ya que ha llevado a cabo la remodelación de su casa con dichos prestamos
texts.en:
Nelvis Ariel O. C. lives in the municipality of Condega. He works making cigars in a factory in the urban sector of the municipality.

He is requesting a loan that will be used for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, blocks, wood, etc. to improve his house and have a better roof under which to live.

He began working at the factory making cigars about five years ago. He works from Monday to Friday, 7am to 5pm. It is worth mentioning that before beginning to work in this business, he was studying in secondary school.

He hopes that with the purchase of these materials that he can repair his house and live more peacefully, even more so during the rainy season to provide a decent roof for his wife.

He is married and lives alone with his wife in their house. He does not yet have children.

This is the fourth loan that he has requested through CEPRODEL in a period of four years. He argues that the impact of these loans has been satisfactory since he has remodeled his house with these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as blocks, zinc, wood, etc.

loans.name: Fenika

texts.en:
Fenika T. is 36, married, and has three children aged between two and eight. She owns a business venture selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Fenika has three years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Fenika joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Fenika's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Taupaolo

texts.en:
Taupaolo T., 32 and married with three children ranging in age from one to eight, owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. With two years of experience in this business, Taupaolo now needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her enterprise.

In 2010, Taupaolo joined SPBD, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Taupaolo's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. VICTORIA DEL CARMEN O.  es comerciante del municipio de Condega y tiene un kiosco de comideria en la estación e buses en este municipio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como son jugos en latas, sodas, materia prima para la elaboración de comidas y venderlas en la parada de buses.

Ella empezó este negocio vendiendo a los pasajeros de buses comidas rápidas en poca cantidad al ir aumentando la demanda ella fue aumentando su negocio hasta lograr poner un kiosco. Ella ha tenido este negocio propio desde hace 20 años y trabaja de los días lunes hasta los días sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Ella era ama de casa antes de dedicarse a este negocio.

Ella espera que con este financiamiento logre comprar los productos que le hacen falta para ofrecer productos completos y satisfacer la demanda y así lograr retener su clientela.

Este es el crédito numero 5 que ella tiene en un periodo de  3 años y ella se demuestra agradecida ya que ha logrado tener crédito con Ceprodel cuando mas a necesitado y así mantener su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingreso
texts.en:
Mrs. VICTORIA DEL CARMEN O. is a merchant in Condega. She has a fast food kiosk in the city bus station. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like canned juices, soft-drinks and ingredients to make the food items she sells at the bus stop. She started this business selling a few fast food items to bus passengers. As demand grew her business did too until she was able to set up a kiosk. She has had her own business for 20 years now and she’s open for business from 7am until 4pm from Monday through Saturday. She used to be a housewife before going into business. She hopes the financing will make it possible for her to buy products she needs to be able to offer complete products and satisfy customer demand thus retaining her customers.
