This is loan number 5 that she’s had over a 3 year period. She is grateful that she was able to get a Ceprodel loan when she needed it most thus being able to keep her business, which is her main source of income, running.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily consumption items (juices, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Xiomara Del Rosario

texts.es:
La joven XIOMARA DEL ROSARIO G. C. es comerciante y reside en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar productos lácteos al por mayor para luego revenderlo y obtener una ganancia.

Ella empezó este negocio con su esposo desde hace unos 4 años hasta lograr establecer una buena clientela y buena demanda de los productos. Ambos hacen dos viajes por semana para comprar los productos lácteos y el resto de la semana lo distribuyen a su cliente y también recogen el dinero de la parte que distribuyen al crédito.

Ella espera que con el financiamiento pueda comprar mas productos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y por ende los ingresos.

Xiomara es casada y tiene una hija que aun no esta en edad escolar.

Este es el segundo préstamo que Xiomara solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de un año, argumentando que dicho préstamo le ha dado un impacto positivo ya que ha logrado aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
XIOMARA DEL ROSARIO G. C. is a merchant living in greater Condega. She is asking for a loan to buy dairy products at Wholesale for subsequent resale to obtain a profit. She started this business with her husband about 4 years ago and has established a good customer base and demand for her products. Both of them make several trips per week to buy dairy products which they distribute to their customers the rest of the time and collect payment on items they sold on credit. She hopes the financing will make it possible for her to buy more products so that sales will increase and consequently so will income. Xiomara is married and has a daughter who is still too little to go to school. This is Xiomara’s second loan with Ceprodel in a one year period. She states that the loan has had a positive impact in that it has brought about an increase in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products at wholesale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Héctor de 41 años, que trabaja como operario en una empresa, y de sus 2 hijos menores, juntos habitan un populoso barrio que esta ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Cada día es de constante trabajo para esta empeñosa mujer; pues no descansa y siempre busca que ayudar a su esposo con los constantes gastos del hogar. Desde hace 1 año instaló en una pieza de su casa el negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, y ahora tiene muchos clientes entre niños y jóvenes que gustan de este tipo de juegos para entretenerse, además  para la atención de este negocio cuenta con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos que lo administra, mientras ella se dirige a trabajar como niñera en una guardería de niños cercana a su casa. Por la labor de cuidar niños recibe un sueldo que le permite comprarse sus gustos; y como si fuera poco también se dedica durante su tiempo libre a la costura de pedrería en diferentes prendas de vestir; y en este negocio trabaja con un intermediario que le deja las prendas y luego le paga cuando las devuelve terminadas. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el sétimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Violeta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una máquina más que necesita para implementar mejor  su negocio de alquiler de  videojuegos, de esta manera espera aumentar la cantidad de clientela que recibe a diario.
texts.en:
Violeta, 41, lives in her own house with her husband, Héctor, 41, who’s employed in a firm as an operator, and their two minor children in a densely populated neighborhood in the north of the city. Every day is a day of constant work for this dedicated woman. She never rests and always looks for ways to help her husband meet household expenses. A year ago she set up a videogame business in one of the rooms in her house. She has a lot of customers, mostly children and youngsters, who like to amuse themselves with these kinds of games. One of her children runs the business while she works as a child care provider at a day care center near her home. The child care job pays her a salary sufficient for her personal needs. If this weren’t enough, she also works attaching beadwork to articles of clothing. In this job, she works with a middleman who leaves the items of clothing with her and then pays her when she delivers the finished products. Since she’s a very enterprising woman, she plans for later in the future to improve the set up in the videogames business in order to improve her profits. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she is very grateful to all the persons who make the loan that will allow her to continue working towards progress possible. Violeta plans to use the requested funds to buy an additional machine for the videogames business hoping thus to increase the number of customers that can visit daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an additional PC to improve her vidiogames business.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis knows how to make a party. As an events entertainment professional based in Hayward, California, he provides music, inflatable jumpers and cotton candy for children's parties, quinceañeras (fifteenth birthdays) and other family events. With two years of operation under his belt, Alexis came to Opportunity Fund to help his business, Alexis Fiestas y Eventos, continue to grow. Family is very important to Alexis. Four years ago he moved to the U.S. from Puebla, Mexico, in order to be closer to his brothers and their families. Upon Alexis' arrival, one of his brothers, who has his own DJ business in the East Bay, encouraged him to enter the party industry. The two brothers now provide referrals to each other and pool their resources for special events. Alexis is proud to be able to support himself working full-time as a business owner and he is optimistic looking forward. “In the next two years, if business remains steady, I hope to be able to hire another employee,” he says. With his $1,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, Alexis will purchase a cotton candy machine, a popular item among his clientele, which will save him money on rentals. The loan will also help Alexis to begin building his credit history – he doesn’t use credit cards and generally tries to avoid debt, but he knows that establishing credit is an important step as a small business owner. He was drawn to Opportunity Fund's low interest rates and simple repayment terms, along with the possibility of future loans as his business continues to grow.

loans.use: To purchase a cotton candy machine to avoid expensive rentals and build his credit history

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa S. is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. For the past year she has owned a business venture running bingo games. Lisa now needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase game prizes, and she plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $163 per week) to improve/expand her enterprise.

Lisa joined SPBD in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Lisa 's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase game prizes

loans.name: Tilieta

texts.en:
Tilieta A. is 32, married, and has five children. She owns a business venture running bingo games. Tilieta has one year of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase game prizes. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Tilieta joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Tilieta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase game prizes

loans.name: Consueloo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Auner de 47 años y de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 son menores, y estudian en el colegio. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica desde hace 18 años, en la venta de pollos en un mercado que esta cerca de la zona donde vive. Dice que a diario debe despertarse al amanecer, pues sus proveedores le dejan los pollos a esa hora, y empieza su labor  en el mercado a partir de  las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene buenas ventas ya que sus caseras la buscan por la calidad de los pollos que ofrece, y también por los precios cómodos. A veces se siente algo cansada pues como trabaja todos los días,  no descansa durante  los fines de semana ni feriados, a veces desea un descanso, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio saldrá adelante, ya que quiere el progreso de su familia. Y como siempre se proyecta para el futuro ya tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de pollos que ofrece, además quiere mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, para proyectar una buena imagen. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Consuelo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en pollos, pues quiere aumentar sus ganancias y así empezara a ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 42, lives in her own house with her husband, Auner, 47, and their four children, three of whom are still minors and go to school. This enterprising woman has been selling chicken in a market near her home for the last 18 years. She says that she has to arise every day at dawn because that’s when her suppliers deliver the chickens. She starts her day at the market at 8am and goes until 4pm. She is very satisfied because she earns good profits because housewives seek her out due to the high quality chicken she offers as well as the comfortable prices. Sometimes she leaves work a bit tired because, since she works every day, she doesn’t rest on weekends or holidays. She sometimes would like a break but knows that sacrifice and effort will lead to success and she wants her family to progress. Besides, she wants to improve her business’ installations so that it will project a better image. This is the 7th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she’s very appreciative of all the people that make the loan that will allow her to continue working possible. Consuelo will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of chickens in order to increase profits and expand the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more crates of chickens to increase profits.

loans.name: Tua

texts.en:
Tua A. is 45, married, and has one child. She owns a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. Tua has one year of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Tua joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Tua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yelba Rosa

texts.es:
Yelba es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada a su pequeño negocio venta de nacatamales, tortillas, frijoles cocidos, lleva tres años en ventas.
Esto lo comenzó con iniciativa propia ya que tiene un taxi que su esposo lo trabaja pero las carreras habeces no están buena lo que decide apoyar haciendo ventas en su casa y lograr atraer clientes.
Su venta de nacatamales que es su plato fuerte en el negocio lo vende ambulante pues su esposo en el taxi sale a ofrecer a las oficinas y la otra parte en casa, ya que por vender tortillas tiene muchos clientes.

Atreves de Afodenic comienza hacer mejoras a un  cuarto lo cual está contenta.
Ahora con este tercer ciclo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para aumentar la producción de nacatamales.
Comprara: quintales de Maíz, carne de cerdo, manteca, quintal de frijoles y lograr mejores ventas.
c
texts.en:
Yelba is a hard working woman who is devoted to her small business selling Nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) tortillas, cooked beans. She’s been in sales for three years. She started this on her own initiative because she has a taxi that her husband drives but sometimes the fares aren’t good so she decided she had to go into sales from home to help him out and attract customers. The Nacatamales are the best sellers in her business so she sells them in an itinerant manner because her husband takes them out in the taxi to sell at various offices; she also sells them from home because she has a lot of customers that come to buy tortillas. Through Afodenic she has started to make some improvements to a room which makes her happy. Now in her third cycle she will buy raw materials to increase Nacatamal production. She will buy quintales of corn, pork, lard, a quintal of beans to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn, lard, pork and other ingredients for Nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) like quintales of beans to increase production.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En las afueras de  Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa conocida como la ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, por la cantidad de arboles que habían de este fruto. Encontramos el Banco Comunal  Los  Ángeles que se reúnen cada quince días. La señora Angélica forma parte de la directiva.

Está casada y tiene una niña de 11 años, se dedica  a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como son el queso y el yogurt, vende ropa y además prepara y vende unos deliciosos bizcochuelos, este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su padre, hace 8 años, también trabaja como impulsadora para una empresa de productos.

Ella junto con su esposo sale a recorrer de lunes a sábados  las tiendas de la localidad donde entrega sus productos, los domingos en el cantón 24 De Mayo aprovecha las ferias para vender, además puerta a puerta también entrega sus productos.  Trabaja de cinco a seis horas al día, los productos los compra donde se producen porque le salen a mejor precio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar un horno para producir sus bizcochuelos que tienen mucha demanda.

Su meta son tener una Hostería con todas sus comodidades.
texts.en:
Just outside Portoviejo, a beautiful city known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, due to its quantity of Tamarind trees, we encounter the Los Angeles Communal Bank which meets every 15 days. Angelica is part of its directing board. She is married and has an 11-year-old daughter. Angelica buys and sells milk products such as cheese and yogurt, and in addition, sells clothes and prepares and sells delicious large biscuits. The business was started with her father's help some 8 years ago. She also works as a sales representative for a products enterprise. Angelica, together with her husband, Mondays through Saturdays, visits the stores in her locality to deliver her products. In the 24 of May canton on Mondays, she takes advantage of local fairs to sell. In addition, she sells her products door to door. She works 5-6 hours a day. Angelica buys her merchandise where it is produced to get a better price. This new loan will be used to buy an oven for baking her biscuits which are in much demand. Her goal is to have a store where she can sell all her commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING AN OVEN TO BAKE HER BISCUITS

loans.name: Mercedes Lorena

texts.es:
En las afueras de  Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa con un clima agradable y con una rica variedad de platos típicos. Encontramos el Banco Comunal  Los  Ángeles que se reúnen cada quince días.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Mercedes, desde hace ocho años se separo de su marido y ahora es padre y madre de dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad y están estudiando en el colegio. Vive con sus hijos en la casa de su mama y comenta que tiene que luchar mucho para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

Es así como un día empezó a vender productos de Hervalife (productos naturales) entre los productos que mas vende están los adelgazantes, vitaminas, crema de baba de caracol, entre otros. Su forma de vender es puerta a puerta aunque ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Trabaja cuatro horas al día todos los días, aprovecha cuando sus hijos están en el colegio ya que después tiene que atenderlos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar adelgazantes y vitaminas por que tiene muchos pedidos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años.
 
Su meta es tener su propia casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
In the suburbs of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with an agreeable climate and with a rich variety of regional dishes we find the "Los Ángeles" Communal Bank which meets every fortnight. Here we speak with Mercedes, she separated from her husband eight years ago and now is father and mother to two children, who are young and are studying at school. She lives with her children at her mother's house and comments that she has to really struggle so that her children do not lack anything. And so she started to sell Hervalife (natural products). The products that she sells the most are the weight-loss products, vitamins, wrinkle creams among others. She sells door to door although she has some regular customers. She works four hours per day every day, taking advantange of the time when her children are in school since she has to look after them after school. This loan will be used to buy weight-loss products and vitamins because she has a lot of orders. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for three years. Her goal is to have her own home and give her children a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weight-loss products and vitamins.

loans.name: Pedro Martin

texts.es: Pedro tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica al negocio de la venta en un mini bazar, en el cual atiende con mucha amabilidad y cordialidad a sus clientes ya que siempre frecuentan su local, Pedro sueña con tener un local mucho mas amplio y asi lograr obtener mas ingresos para poder sustentar a su familia, el solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia, se le brinda el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old and his job is working in sales at a mini bazaar, where he attends to his clients with kindness and warmth since they always frequent his place of business. Pedro dreams of having a much larger place of business, that way he will be able to obtain more income to be able to support his family. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of merchandise. He is being granted the loan for having the ability to repay and good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Owaon, Dapitan City. She is 51 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a reloading store. The main source of income for the business comes from providing reload services to local community members. Delia is just starting this business.
In 2006, Delia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to pay her children's tuition fees. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase house materials. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase house materials

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for fish vending. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Michelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: María Ernestina

texts.es: María Ernestina G. D. A. es una señora D. 56 años D. edad resiD. en en el municipio D. Soyapango,  adonD. vive con su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, lugar adonD. tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. combustible y lubricantes para autos y motocicletas. Dicho negocio cuenta con varios años funcionando, y es la única forma D. financiar los gastos familiares, el pedido del préstamo es, para ampliar su negocio, además D. comprar producto D. mejor calidad y darles más variedad a sus clientes, María es una mujer emprendedora conocida por sus vecinos como una persona alegre y con muchos deseos D. superarse, así como el D. ayudar a sus hijos para tener una mejor vida y estudios.
texts.en:
María Ernestina G. D. A. is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango with her husband and three young children. She has a small business where she sells fuel and lubricants for autos and motorcycles. She has been running this business for several years and it is the only source of income she has to pay for the household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase better quality products and expand her business in order to offer more variety to her customers. María is an enterprising woman known by her neighbors to be a happy person who wants to better herself. In addition, she wishes to help her children have a better life and an education.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase motor oil and lubricants.

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma S. V. de 55 años de edad, cuenta con un negocio de comida rápida adonde brinda el servicio de bebidas y comida, ubicado en el municipio de Soyapango, en el mismo lugar adonde reside con una hija, siendo ella su única ayuda, ya que es divorciada no cuenta con más ayuda financiera además del ya mencionado. El préstamo ha sido solicitado, para poder invertir  en el negocio y así hacerlo crecer, comprando vegetales, verduras granos básicos y otros más para la elaboración de la comida, además de cancelar un crédito actual, María Vilma es una mujer emprendedora que ha utilizado sus habilidades en la cocina para ayudar a su hija y poder suplir sus necesidades básicas, es conocida por dar un buen servicio, además de su deliciosa comida.
texts.en:
55-year old María Vilma S. V. runs a fast food and drinks stall located in the municipality of Soyapango, where she lives with her daughter. She is the only support for her daughter as she is divorced and gets no financial help except from the business she runs. María would use the loan she is seeking to invest in the business and make it grow. She would buy vegetables, grains, and other ingredients to make food and pay off a debt she has currently. María is an enterprising woman who has used her cooking skills to provide her daughter with the basic necessities. She is known for providing good service as well as delicious food.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús R. E. es un seño de 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa y está a cargo de dos nietos  menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de Manuel, su residencia se ubica en Soyapango. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa ambulante que comercializa con su esposa, en la calles de San Salvador, este es un negocio muy difícil pero es su única entrada de dinero lo cual ayuda a la pareja a saldar su deudas, por lo que se esfuerzan mucho día con día,  el préstamo ha sido solicitado para poder invertir más en la ropa que ellos compran, y poder ayudarse para tener un pequeño lugar en el que sea más fácil la comercialización del producto.
texts.en:
64-year old Manuel de Jesús R. E. lives with his wife and is responsible for two young grandchildren who attend school thanks to his efforts. His home is in Soyapango. He and his wife earn their living selling clothing on the streets of San Salvador. It’s a very difficult job, but it is the only income they have to pay their debts so they work hard every day. The loan that Manuel is seeking will be used to buy more clothing and eventually to obtain a stall from which it would be easier to sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Christine has a business running a bar, which she has had for 5 years.  She also generates additional income by selling milk and dairy products.  

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks for the bar and milk.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and save for herself, and also buy food.  In the future, Christine hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.   

Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by letting her increase her business capital and learn how to behave to people.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her children are currently in school.  Maria has a business running a restaurant, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food to stock, like sugar and rice.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her family's food and school fees.  In the future, Maria hopes to own a house and another retail shop.  

Maria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to expand a business and be responsible.

loans.use: to buy food to stock like sugar and rice

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  Neither of her children is currently in school.  Stella has a business of selling plastic materials for home use, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to invest in another business like rearing chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and help her with her transport costs.  In the future, Stella hopes to go back to school and expand her business more.        

Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing her business sense.

loans.use: to invest in another business like rearing chickens

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling dried fish, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy more food at home.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a house for her family.     

 Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to expand a business and become self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sebastian Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Sebastian A. O. tiene 27 años y vive en el barrio 4 de julio de la ciudad de Tarija . Sebastian aun no es casado y vive en una casa en alquiler, se dedica a la actividad del servicio de gomeria, y reparación de llantas de bicicletas y motocicletas. 

Sus padres le dotaron de un terreno donde el esta construyendo una vivienda . Sebastian tiene pensado formar un hogar , tener hijos y nietos. El credito que esta solicitando sera destinado a la compra de herramientas de trabajo.  Sebastian nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es tener su vivienda terminada .tambien nos cuenta que el proximo credito que solicite  lo hara para la compra de una computadora.
texts.en:
Mr. Sebastian A. O. is 27 years old and lives in the 4 de Julio barrio in Tarija. Sebastian is single and lives in a rented house. He is in the business of bicycle and motorcycle tire repair. His parents have given him land on which he is building a house. He plans to make a home and have children and grandchildren. He will use the loan to purchase work tools. Sebastian says that his greatest dream is to have his home completed. His next loan request will be for the purchase of a computer.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of work tools, operating capital.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Sr Cristóbal U. A. es casado con la señora Cristina Gonzales hace 22 años atrás, total tienen 6 hijos, 4 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven en Colomi comunidad Canco a 5 km hacia el norte.
El Sr. Cristóbal y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola que tienen ingresos anuales, después de cosechar lleva a comercializar a la feria semanal de Colomi, nos comenta que siempre a estado manteniendo a su familia de esta forma, también tiene ganado vacuno que los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas así para economizar gastos

El señor Cristóbal se aproximo a nuestras oficinas para solicitar crédito a CIDRE, para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y avena para sus ganados lo cual le falto dinerito según él, con esto seguir mejorando su actividad económica y responder al estudio de sus hijos que por ultimo nos dice luchara por el futuro de sus hijos que salgan profesionales que no sean ya como yo él.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristóbal U. A. has been married to Cristina Gonzales for the last 22 years. They have 6 children; 4 of them are dependent children who are still in school. They live in the community of Kanco, 5 km north of Colomi. Mr. Cristóbal and his wife earn annual income from agricultural production. After harvesting, he takes his produce to the Colomi weekly market. He tells us that he has always supported his family in this manner. He also has cattle which he uses in his farm work in order to save on expenses. Mr. Cristóbal approached our offices to request a loan from CIDRE. He told us that he didn’t have money but he needed to purchase organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and oats for his livestock. With the money from the loan, he will continue to improve his business and provide an education for his children. Lastly he told us that he will fight for his children’s future so that they will become professionals and not end up as he has.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer for agricultural production.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El señor A. Campos S. tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente más de 21 años con la señora Severina Merubia Terrazas, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven en Colomi comunidad Pucara km 45 km hacia el sud sobre la carretera Cbba Santa Cruz, ambos se dedican a la producción agrícola.

A. Campos y su esposa nos comentan que su hijo de 22 años ha fallecido hace dos meses atrás, lo cual han tenido gastos fuertes económicamente, razones que les falto para comprar abono orgánico y semilla de papa, se apersonaron a nuestras oficinas de CIDRE a solicitar un préstamo que de tal modo les sobro parcelas preparadas, según ellos nos dicen lo que producen papa, haba, oca, papaliza es el único ingreso económico que perciben anualmente, mantiene de esta forma a su familia también gastos para su estudio de sus dos hijos que están en nivel primaria por ultimo dice que sembrara en mas superficies.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Campos S., 41, has been in a union with Mrs. Severina Merubia Terrazas for over 21 years. They have two dependent children who are students. They live in Colomi, Pucara, 45 kilometers to the south along the Cochabamba-Santa Cruz highway. Both are farmers. A. Campos and his wife comment that the death of their 22-year-old son two months ago brought about some unexpected high expenses that made it impossible for them to be able to buy organic manure and potato seed. They came by our CIDRE offices in person to request a loan because they had prepared fields ready. According to them, they produce potatoes, lima beans, oca (a tuber), papalisa (an Andean tuber). This is their only source of yearly income with which they support the family and pay for the education of their two children who are in primary school. Lastly, they say they will plant larger surfaces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy organic manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Fabio Benito

texts.es:
Fabio tiene la edad de 28 años, casado, tiene un trabajo fijo como supervisor técnico electrónico desde hace cuatro años, y ha  logrado el alquiler de dos cuartos con lo que se ha ayudado económicamente, su esposa le tiene un hijo el cual desea dar estudios.
Los cuartos los construyo en sociedad con su familia. Así mismo trabaja en el negocio de la familia en la reparación y supervisión de celulares.

Con este préstamo lograra comprar materiales en la reparación de celulares como: compra de fuente de poder digital, pistola de color weller, juego de desarmadores, multimetros digital, cautil estación para soldador.
Lo que vendrá a dar un mejor servicio con nuevas herramientas ya que no cuentan con ellas. Y que gracias al financiamiento otorgado por Afodenic están obteniendo herramientas necesarias para su pequeño negocio familiar que vendrá hadar un giro diferente en la producción.
texts.en:
Fabio, 28, is married and has had a regular job working as an electronics technician supervisor for 4 years. He has managed to rent 2 rooms, which has helped him economically. With his wife he has a son, and he wants to provide him with an education. The rooms were built in partnership with his family. He also works in the family business supervising and repairing cellular phones. With this loan, he will buy materials to repair cellular phones, such as: digital power supplies, a Weller heat gun, a set of screwdrivers, digital multimeters, and soldering iron. He will be able to provide better service with these new tools, which he does not currently have. Thanks to the loan granted by AFODENIC, they are getting the tools they need for their small family business, which will allow them to take their business in a new direction.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to repair cell phones, such as: digital power supplies, heat guns, a screwdriver set, and other items needed for the business

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is a 48-year-old single mother of two who lives in Heredia, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica with her children. 

Ana runs a small store which is attached to her house. She offers products such as toilet paper, cleaning products, car products as well as photocopying services.  Her clients consist mainly of local community members. Ana has been running her business over the past 4 years. 

 Ana plans to use this loan to invest in the diversification of the products she has to offer her customers. In an effort to meet the needs of a more varied clientele, she will be purchasing jewellery items (necklaces, bracelets) as well as school supplies (books, pencils, notepads). 

Ana wakes up every day at 5:30 AM, she prepares breakfast for her children, and carries out various domestic chores.  She opens her store at 8 AM and tends to the needs of her customers throughout the day. At midday, Ana takes her lunch and at 4 PM her children return from school. At this point, Ana juggles the tasks of mother and store owner until closing time at 8 PM. 

Ana´s goal is to offer more variety to her clients in terms of products. She wants her business to grow, increase revenue to a level where the family could be self-sufficient, depending only on the store's income. She hopes to one day pass on a successful business to her children.
 
A constraining factor in Ana´s life has been  the death of her son 2 years ago. She has been dependent on the support of her family to get through emotionally difficult times.

loans.use: For the purchase of store inventory such as jewellery and school supplies

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
Durante toda su vida la Sra.Doris trabajo en diferentes oficios lo ultimo que recuerda es  haber vendido artículos D. ferretería los que compraba D. fabrica a menor costo y los vendía, era un buen negocio  pero por dedicarse  a su familia lo dejo,aprovechando que su casa esta en una avenida principal  pensó en poner su propio negocio probo con la venta D. comida pero no le fue bien y  por motivos D. enfermedad ya no siguió después se dio cuenta que por su barrio no había un locutorio donD. la gente pueda hacer llamadas telefónicas es así que junto a su familia deciden invertir en este nuevo negocio esto le ha brindado tranquilidad debido a su estado D. salud lo pueD. manejar por que es mas tranquilo también aprovecha y venD. algunas golosinas al publico que entra, para mas adelante quiere cambiar D. rubro y poner una tienda D. ropa para bebes,por que no  hay ese negocio en su zona, lo que hará con su préstamo es comprar una vitrina para su locutorio para exhibir sus golosinas como chocolates, gaseosas y galletas. Ella esta agradecida por que con su trabajo apoya a su esposo que es docente con un sueldo bajo, trabajando los dos pueden solventar los gastos familiares, su grupo es nuevo y se llama “SAN JUDAS TADEO”  ella es la presidenta D. grupo que  lo conforman 08 socias.

*Doris esta con anteojos es la 6ta D. las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris has had different jobs throughout her life. She remembers the last job she held was selling hardware items that she bought at low cost. It was a good business, but she quit in order to dedicate time to her family. Since her home is located on one of the main roads, she took advantage of this opportunity to establish her own business selling food. However, due to illness, she did not do well and was not able to continue. Afterwards she recognized that her neighborhood did not have a call center where people could make telephone calls. Together with her family, she decided to invest in this new business because it is calmer and she can manage it in her state of health. Doris will also sell candy to anyone who enters her business. In the distant future, she plans to transition to another type business and open a store selling baby clothes since this type of establishment does not exist in the area.

Doris will use her loan to buy a display case to install in her call center for storing sweets such as chocolates, soft drinks, and cookies. She is grateful to be working since she can help her husband, who is a teacher and earns low pay, cover the family expenses. Her Communal Bank group is called “San Judas Tadeo”. She serves as President of this group which consists of eight members.

*Doris is the sixth woman in the photograph wearing eyeglasses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case for selling sweets

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Cuando su esposo fue despedido del trabajo la Sra. Nelly se preocupo mucho, ella trabajaba en casa pero no le alcanzaba el dinero, peor aun por que cobraba cada 15 días y el dinero era poco para los gastos familiares. es asi que decide trabajar por su cuenta al principio lo hizo ayudando a una señora que vendía comida pero poco a poco aprendió el negocio y lo hizo por su propia cuenta compro algunas ollas pequeñas y una mesita así empezó a cocinar y vender comida a los trabajadores de un paradero de transporte publico, ella tenia  mucho miedo de fracasar pero se sorprendio cuando le falto comida para empezar fue un exito, eso fue un gran impulso para seguir adelante su negocio ha crecido ahora tienes muchos comensales la mayoría son choferes y cobradores quienes consumen lo que ella prepara como comidas y sopas, ahora que hace frio vende mucho, se siente feliz por que de esa manera ayuda a su esposo para que sus hijos puedan estudiar a la vez que también ha mejorado su casita lo que ella quiere es tener su propio restaurante aunque le da temor hacerlo esa es su meta para un futuro cercano, su préstamo le servirá para comprar sus ingredientes ella compra sus insumos por mayor de esa manera ahorra mas y sus ganancias son mayores, “ MADRES LADEREÑAS” es un grupo nuevo ella es la presidenta recién nombrada y espera trabajar junto a sus 10 compañeras todas viven en la zona de Puente Piedra Lima Perú.

La Sra Nelly es la tercera de las paradas esta con chompa rosada y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
When her husband lost his job, Sra. Nelly was greatly concerned. She worked from home but did not earn enough money. What made things worse was that she accumulated family expenses every 15 days, but there was not enough money to cover them. Nelly decided to work by herself at first, but then she began helping another woman sell food and gradually learned the business. She bought a few small pots and a table so that she could begin cooking and selling food to the workers at a bus stop. Nelly was afraid of failing, so she was surprised when she ran out of food because she had gotten off to a great start. She is determined to move her business forward now that she has many customers, most of whom are drivers and fare collectors who buy the food she prepares. Nelly prepares meals and soups, which she sells more of now that the weather is colder. She is very happy that she can help her husband with paying for their children’s education and making improvements to their home. Nelly wants to have her own restaurant in the near future even though the thought makes her apprehensive.

Her loan will be used to buy ingredients and supplies in bulk, which will help her save more and generate better earnings. The Communal Bank “Madres Ladereñas” is a new group and Nelly was recently named its President. The group consists of ten members who plan to work together. They all live in the district of Puente Piedra in Lima, Peru.

Sra. Nelly is the woman in the back wearing a pink sweatshirt and gray vest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 40 años vive en San Martin D. Porres lima Perú, tiene 03 hijos ella antes atendía la bodega D. su madre  como ya tenia experiencia al mudarse a su terreno decidió poner su propia bodega, pensando que D. esa manera a la vez que trabajaba no descuidaba a sus hijos y realmente fue así los día que tiene mayor venta son los fines D. semana ella venD. todo tipo D. productos pero lo que mas le sale son las bebidas y comestibles, otro ingreso que tiene es el alquiler D. departamentos en el segundo piso D. su casa lo que hace con sus ganancias es terminar algunos acabados en uno D. los predios que alquilara, también apoya a sus hijos en sus estudios.
La Sra. Consuelo quiere estudiar cosmetología por que su sueño es poner su salón D. belleza en un ambiente D. su casa el cual acondiciona para ese fin, su préstamo actual le va a servir para hacer unos retoques en uno D. los departamentos que alquilara, por otro lado ella es la tesorera del grupo “MUJERES BUSCANDO UN FUTURO” el grupo esta formado por 10 socias.

* Consuelo esta sentada con ropa negra.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 40 years old and lives in San Martin D. Porres, in Lima, Peru. She has 3 children and used to work in her mother's small grocery store. With that work experience, when Consuelo moved to her own house she decided to run her own small store from her home. She thought that this would allow her to work without neglecting her children, and it has worked out well for her. Her best days in terms of sales are on the weekends. She sells all kinds of products but drinks and food items sell the best. Consuelo also has some additional income from renting out apartments on the second floor of her house. With the money she earns she is making some improvements to one of the units she will be renting out, and she also uses her income to support her children's education. Consuelo would like to study cosmetology because her dream is to set up a beauty salon in one of the rooms of her house, which she is remodeling for that purpose.She will use this loan to make improvements to one of the apartments she rents out. Consuelo is the treasurer of the “Mujeres buscando un futuro” [Women looking for a future] group, which has 10 members. * Consuelo is seated in the photo, and is wearing black clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish making improvements to rental apartments

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a housewife and the mother of one daughter and two sons: Fatina, 5 years old; Muhammad, 3 years old; and Ahmed, 1 year old.

Asma's husband, Ahmed, is a Palestinian National Authority employee and drives a taxi after his working hours. He drives passengers between the two cities of Gaza and Rafah. He appears in the photo next to his taxi.

The taxi needs urgent maintenance and therefore Asma came to FATEN and took a $1,200 loan in order to help her husband perform the necessary maintenance.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen Q. is a housewife and the mother of one daughter. Her husband, Sami, started a new business three years ago when he rented a small shop and started a barber shop for men. The shop is doing well and attracts a good number of clients.

Haneen's husband, who appear in the photo in his shop, is a nice man known for his good manners and his sense of humor. After three years in business, he wants to start fixing up his shop to make it look better. Therefore, Haneen took a $2,000 loan to help him perform the changes.

loans.use: To enable her husband to fix up his barbershop

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine Muhammad R. and her husband, Asaad, own a grocery store in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. They have four sons and one daughter who are school students and under 18. Sabrine shares working in the store with her husband and sometimes their children help when they don't have homework.

Sabrine took a $1,500 loan from FATEN to purchase a display fridge for the frozen goods they sell and also to  purchase more goods as people consume more food during the holy month of Ramadan.

Sabrine's husband appears in the photo as Sabrine doesn't like to be photographed.

loans.use: To purchase a display fridge and more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enable her husband to expand his store

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a housewife and mother from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She has four sons and one daughter.

Ghada’s husband, Hamed, is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a taxi driver. The salary he receives forced him to find another job to be able to raise the five children he has, especially with the hard living conditions in Gaza Strip. The taxi business is helping the family to cover their expenses and live a better life.

Ghada is a loyal client of FATEN, having taken three previous loans. She is taking a $3,000 loan from FATEN as her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi as it's been in service for seven years now and needs a few modifications and more frequent maintenance.

in the photo, Ghada's oldest son, Shadi, stands next to the taxi.

loans.use: To enable her husband to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Luai

texts.en:
Luai M. is from Tulkarem city in the northern part of Palestine. He is married and is the father of three sons.

Luai inherited a stall in the old city from his father, where he sells basic kitchen stuff and food. He also distributes a certain brand of biscuits to shops in the old city.

Luai came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan in order to purchase a large amount of the goods he sells so as to increase his returns. This store is the only source of income for the family and the loan will help him improve his financial situation.

Luai appears in the photo in FATEN's office. He didn't want to be photographed in the old market for social reasons.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of the goods he sells

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a young woman from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She is married and the mother of one daughter, Maha. Fida's husband also takes care of his old parents.

Fida's husband is a barber. He owns a shop he inherited from his father and, five years ago, he decided to use it to start his own business. He now wants to apply a few changes to his barbershop to make it look better in order to attract more customers.

Fida is taking a $1,500 loan to help her husband fix up his barbershop. The photo shows him in the barbershop as he is the one working there. The business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: To enable her husband to fix up his barbershop

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es: Hilaria tiene 45 años y vive en la Mz. E en Huaycán, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, DesD. ya hace 8 años que trabaja con Edaprospo y hace solo 4 meses presidenta del grupo “Virgen D. Copacabana” el cual es conformado por 15 personas que también son devotas a la misma virgen, eh ahí el origen el nombre del grupo. Hilaria vendía ocasionalmente quesos D. casa en casa y también se dedicaba a trabajos D. limpieza ocasionales, mas desD. hace 5 años que trabaja D. lleno en la compra y venta D. Quesos que trae desD. Huarochirí, la calidad D. este producto y el capital brindado por Edaprospo le ah conseguido un buen grupo D. clientes y D. mercadería para abastecerlos, mas ella espera poner su propia tienda D. venta para así ayudar D. una mejor forma en los estudios superiores D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Hilaria, 45, lives on block E in Huaycán. She’s married and has a son. She has been collaborating with Edaprospo for 8 years and for the last four months has been President of the “Virgen D. Copacabana” communal bank which has 15 members also devoted to that Virgin, thus the group name. Hilaria used to sell cheese occasionally from home and also did cleaning jobs sometimes. But, for the last 5 years she has been working fulltime as a cheese merchant. She brings them from Huarochirí. The quality of the product and capital from Edaprospo has secured a good group of customers and merchandise to supply them. However, she hopes to set up her own store so that she can better support her son’s higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Evelyn comenzó vendiendo ropa como ambulante hace 4 años, ya tiene 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo y ah puesto su propio comercial en el que venD. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad, espera pronto recolectar suficiente dinero para conseguir un lugar donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad todo lo que son artículos textiles, ella fue recientemente elegida presidenta del grupo Paz y Bien, nombre elegido por el colegio chino que se encuentra en su zona, el grupo está conformado por 10 personas las cuales son amigas y vecinas, Aunque ella es soltera y se mantiene a si misma, esta ya terminando sus estudios D. Tele marketing y espera, junto con sus amigas, poder alcanzar sus metas D. desarrollo.
texts.en:
Evelyn started as a clothing peddler four years ago. She has been collaborating with Edaprospo for a year and has set up her own store where she sells groceries and basic need items. She hopes to soon have enough money to get a place where she can more comfortably sell everything related to textiles. She was recently elected President of the Paz y Bien (Peace and Wellbeing) group, a name selected because of a Chinese school located in the area. The group has 10 members who are friends and neighbors. Although she’s single and supports herself she is about to finish studying Telemarketing and hopes, together with her friends, to reach their development goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella I. is a 46 year old mother of two children and wife of Mabini I., a farmer. She did not tie herself to the role of being just a mother and a wife. She wanted to be an entrepreneur and to augment the income her husband. Her determination is based on the increasing financial demands due to the costs of education for her children. 

To enhance her productive role, being a woman, Bella joined ASHI in 2005 with the consent of her husband. She then used her loan to start up a sari-sari store (“sari” is a native word for variety). Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place. Eventually, Bella’s business grew and she has saved money from her business profits. The amount of loan she is qualified to avail from ASHI grew, thus she was able to have more options of developing another business. The couple plan to start a new venture in hog fattening. After four months of fattening, the pigs will be sold, either alive or slaughtered, for its meat to be sold per kilo. Bella believes the profit from this business will generate good profits to augment her husband’s irregular income. 

Bella’s present loan will be used as additional working capital for her sari-sari (variety) store and some portions will be spent for the hog fattening business. She dreams of building a branch of her variety store at a nearby village and town. She hopes to see her children finish school until they complete college and find stable jobs.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her sari-sari (variety) store and some portions will be spent for the hog fattening business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela C. is 54 years old and has three children whose ages range from 19 to 28 years old. She is married to Romeo C., a farmer. Adela and her family live in a municipality called the North Peninsula of Antique which is Pandan. The place is rich in natural resources. Pandan is surrounded by verdant mountains and blue ocean that sparkles during the daytime.

Adela has been practicing her knowledge of dealing with different people by operating a sari-sari (variety) store for the past three years. This has been her business and her source of income. The profit she has made has helped her husband a lot to augment the family income. Her previous loan from ASHI supported her business and her husband's farming ventures. Since she was able to repay her previous loan, she is now qualified to apply for another loan of a higher amount to support her business. Now, she plans to utilize this loan and her future loans in the same business until it grows. She wishes that someday she could set up a mini-grocery store in their village where she can provide her customers with convenient purchases.

Adela's aspiration is that all her children will graduate from college with degrees and have a good life. This is the reason why she wants her business to succeed. Through business success, Adela hopes to build her own dream house. Her loan from Kiva through ASHI is a very important factor that could lead her towards fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.name: Flordeliza Cartajenas Group

texts.en:
Flordeliza C. is from the village of Sangay Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child and three adult children. Flordeliza is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if one of them is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Flordeliza Cartajena’s Group.

To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan that Flordeliza has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana M. lives in the historic city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its culture. She is a 35-year-old housewife as well as a businesswoman who manages her domestic chores & business very well. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are attending school and getting their education. 

Rukhsana supports her family by doing sewing. She collects orders from neighborhood clients and supplies the finished goods on time to earn an income. Her business is doing well and she earns a reasonable income from it every month.

Her husband is a scrap dealer by trade and operates a scrap shop in the market. Both of their earning help them to support their household and to pay the education expenses of their kids. They have a dream to give their children better education facilities so as to make their future bright by getting good jobs.    

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband in his scrap business. With the loan amount he will buy scrap and increase his earning.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous loans, she maintained a good record and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

Violeta has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rubilyn's Group

texts.en:
Rubilyn G. is from the village of Maluno Sur. She is 40 years old. Rubilyn is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rubilyn G.'.

Rubilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rubilyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rubilyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilyn is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rubilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena N. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 33 years old. Ma. Elena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Elena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ma. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make cooked food for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma. Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Theresita

texts.en:
In 2009, Theresita found an opportunity to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI and she was inspired by the stories of poor women of ASHI. She wanted to become successful like them, thus loans she has had since then are used in her business. Because of the opportunity of borrowing, Theresita was able to start up a fishing business.  She is courageous enough to take the risk of running a business she thought she could be successful with because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream she kept in her mind--having all her children finish their schooling until they complete college. 

Theresita had never hoped for anything but that her family and her children would not to experience the hard life she and her husband had experienced. She dreams of wider space for fishing equipment and an expanded fishing business.

loans.use: To support her fishing business

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city in Pakistan and a popular city known for its history and culture. She lives in the area of Yadgar with her husband and three children. All three of her children are working. Her eldest son has a business making furniture. Her middle son and the youngest son work as salesmen in a department store. None of her children could complete their education due to financial reasons and had to leave their education to help support the family financially. 

Perveen supports her family financially with her sewing work. She sews clothes for neighborhood clients specifically. She is good at it and gets regular orders. She charges between 100-150 PKRs for each dress which doesn’t feel high to her customers and they give her good orders.  

She has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her eldest son with his furniture-making business. With the loan amount he will buy wood, nails and a furniture polisher of good quantity which will enable him to make more furniture for his business and improve his sales. 

Perveen is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 4th loan. In every loan year she has been found very responsible in paying back her installments and in attending meetings.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails and a polisher for furniture-making business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer D. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 27 years old. Jennifer is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
