loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan V. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 34 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Joan owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Joan is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Lahore, which is famous for its history and culture. She has a four-room brick house there where she lives with her family. She is 39 years old and is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her three younger children are getting their education and are in different standards. Her eldest son is 18 years old. He didn’t ever show any interest in education, and therefore started driving a rickshaw.

Zarina’s husband’s name is M. S. and he is a welder. He operates his welding shop in the market where he welds electrical machinery.

Zarina supports her family by operating a small grocery shop adjacent to her home. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife but also manages her grocery shop very well.

Zarina has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah for her grocery business. With the loan, she will buy more grocery items like rice, cooking oil, lentils and spices to increase her sales. She has confidence in herself and confidence that she will be able to increase her income if she gets money to invest.

Zarina is a very responsible member and has paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en: Chynar Z. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-two and a widow. She has three children: her sons are thirty and twenty-three while her daughter is twenty-eight. Her elder son and daughter work in another town and her youngest son is at home. Chynar breeds livestock. She started to breed livestock three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms upon the suggestion of her relatives. She earns 3,000 soms each month which enabled her to make capital repairs to her house and to increase the number of her livestock. Chynar is applying for a loan in order to purchase two farm animals for breeding. In the future, she is planning to increase the number of her livestock and to celebrate her son's wedding. The other group members are: Batma D. is the treasurer of the group. She is fifty and is married with three children: her twin daughters are sixteen and her son is fourteen. All of them got to school. Her husband is director at the local administration and his monthly income is 5,000 soms. Batma breeds cattle. She started cattle breeding three years ago with initial investment of 10,000 soms upon the suggestion of her neighbor. Now, she earns 3,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to make capital repairs to her house. Bumairam M. is fifty-eight and is a widow. She has four children: her sons are thirty-four, thirty-two and twenty-five and her daughter is twenty-nine. Her elder son and daughter work in Russia, while her other two sons are married and live with Bumairam. Bumairam breeds cattle with the help of her sons. She has been ten years in the cattle-breeding business that she started with an initial investment of 8,000 soms. Her monthly income from cattle breeding is 3,000 soms. She is planning to purchase additional cattle and is therefore applying for a loan. In the future, she is planning to see her youngest son married. Shaarbu M. is fifty-eight and married with five children: her daughters are thirty, twenty-five and nineteen, and her sons are twenty-nine and twenty-eight years old. Her husband is a builder with an income of 5,000 soms. Shaarbu breeds cattle with the help of her husband. She started cattle breeding thirty years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms and her monthly income from cattle breeding is 3,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. It will enable her to expand her business through increase in the turnover. In the future, she is planning to continue to reinvest her profits in the business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase two farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Kanykei's Group

texts.en: Kanykei A. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight and married with three children: her sons are nineteen and thirteen and her daughter is two years old. Her elder son works in Russia and each month he sends her 6,000 soms. Her youngest children are at home. Kanykei sells convenience goods: four years ago she applied for a loan and opened a shop near her house. She started her business with 5,000 soms and now earns 8,000 soms monthly. With the profits from her business, she has been able to buy a microwave and cattle for breeding. Kanykei is applying for a loan in order to purchase construction materials to make capital repairs to her house. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and buy a big shop. The other group members are: Gulnara B. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-five and married with three children: her daughters are thirteen and eight and her son is sixteen. All her children go to school. Her husband works in Russia. Gulnara grows rice and sunflowers, a business she started seven years ago with initial investment of 4,500 soms. She now earns 3,500 soms from farming. With the profits from farming, she was able to build a house and purchase cattle. She has applied for a loan to purchase construction materials in order to make capital repairs to her house. In the future, with the help of the profits from her business, she plans to educate her children and improve the living conditions of her family. Zhanysh B. is forty-nine and married with four children: his son is twelve and his daughters are ten, eighteen and twenty-one years old. His youngest daughter goes to school and his other children work in Russia. His wife is a housewife. Zhanysh farms rice and millet, a business he started five years ago with an initial investment of 6,000 soms. Currently, he earns 4,000 soms monthly. He is planning to start cattle breeding and is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle. In the future, he is planning to buy a car. Sveta A. is forty-seven and married with four children: her sons are twenty-one, sixteen and one year old and her daughter is twenty-one years old. Her elder son works in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and sends home each month 5,000 soms to his family. Sveta’s three youngest children are at home. She farms millet, rice and sunflowers with the help of her second son. She started ten years ago with initial investment of 6,000 soms and now earns 5,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer to continue farming millet, rice and sunflowers. In the future, with the profits from her business, she is planning to purchase a car and a plot of land. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Nadirakan's Group

texts.en: Nadirakan S. is thirty-one and married with two children: her son is eight years old goes to school and her daughter is two years old and is at home. Nadirakan breeds cattle with the help of her husband. She started cattle breeding ten years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms. Now, she earns 1,500 soms each month. With the profits from her business, she has already built a house and bought furniture for it. Nadirakan is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. Having additional cattle will allow her to increase her turnover and consequently increase her profits. In the near future, she is planning to help her children enter institutions of higher education. The other group members are: Dilafruz H. is treasurer of the group. She is twenty-eight and married with four sons. Her youngest son is at home and her husband works in Russia. Dilafruz started farming six years ago with an initial investment of 2,000 soms and now her monthly income is 1,500 soms. Her mother-in-law helps her with the farming. With the profits from her business, Dilafruz made capital repairs to her house. She is applying for a loan to have sufficient funds for sowing wheat. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, she is planning to build a new house. Nurzita S. K. is twenty-six and single. She has been involved in agriculture since she was six years old so she has already been twenty years in agriculture. She started her own business with an initial investment of 5,000 soms and now earns 2,000 soms, raising wheat and sunflowers. With the profits from agriculture, she purchased furniture and made capital repairs to her house. She is applying for a loan in order to have funds to continue sowing and raising wheat and sunflowers. In the future, she is planning to buy a flat, get married, and buy a car. Alina O. K. is nineteen and single. She breeds cattle, a business she started ten years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms. She now earns 1,500 soms monthly. With the profits from cattle breeding, she bought a television, a DVD player, a mini-system and furniture. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle. With the increased profits from cattle breeding, she is planning to pay her tuition fees to the institution of higher education and improve her living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en: Suraiya lives in a big city called Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 35 years old and lives with her family in a one-room brick house. She belongs to a poor family. She got married to M. J., who has a business making shoes to earn money for the family. He has been engaged in this business for the past 16 years. He works for some big factories that give him orders to fulfill. Suraiya supports her family financially as a midwife. She is the mother of four sons, all of whom are very young and getting their education. Suraiya’s husband wants to expand his shoe-making business by introducing his work to more factories. To do this, he needs raw materials. Suraiya has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, her husband will buy leather, nails, and shoe polish in larger quantities. She is hopeful that, with the help of a loan, her husband will be able to improve his business, and that will help her family to enjoy a better quality of life. Suraiya is in her second loan cycle. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed meetings.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida S. is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old and married. She has a son who is eleven years old. Her husband is retired. Zubaida grows rice and sunflowers. Her husband helps her with the farming. She started this activity seven years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Now, she earns 7,000 KGS monthly from her farming business. She decided to start breeding cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle, which will be the start for her cattle-breeding business. In the future, she is planning to buy a house in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan.
 
Group members:
Nurzhamal S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 44 years old and married. She has a daughter who is 16 years old. Her daughter goes to school. Her husband works in Russia. She is a farmer. She started farming seven years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 KGS spent on sowing sunflowers. Now, she earns 5,000 KGS monthly. She decided to start breeding cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she plans to build a house.
 
Shazada M. is 50 years old and married. Her husband is retired, and his monthly retirement allowance is 2,500 KGS. Her daughter is 17 and enrolled in an institution of higher education. She farms sunflowers and rice. She started farming ten years ago with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS. Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle and start breeding them. In the future, she is planning to build a house and purchase furniture for it.
 
Aiymkan B. is 62 years old and a widow. She has two sons who are 26 and 24 years old. Her older son works in Russia, and her younger son is a trader. She grows rice and sunflowers. Her younger son helps Aiymkan with the farming work in his free time. Three years ago she started farming with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS. Her current income is 5,000 KGS. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle to start breeding them.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers, as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children: three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son is involved in a business selling jewelry. The second son has an embroidery business. The youngest son drives a rickshaw. Her daughter is 24 years old and stays at home to operate her sewing business. All of the children make financial contributions to their family from their work.
  
Her husband is M. A., and he is a mason. Nagina owns and operates a business selling clothes in order to support her family financially. She purchases clothes from different cities (such as Multan and Faisalabad) and sells them in her native city to earn a good profit. She has been doing this work for the past ten years. Nagina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her own business. With the loan amount she will purchase clothes in bulk to increase her sales. This is her third loan cycle. In previous loan years she has been a responsible loan user of Asasah by paying her installments on time and never missing any meetings.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S., from the village of Mibantang, Quezon, Bukidnon, is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Teresa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

Lalaine is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 40 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the thirteenth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.name: Fedelina's Group

texts.en:
Fedelina B. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Fedelina is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fedelina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fedelina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Fedelina is just starting this business.

In 2010, Fedelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fedelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Viktr

texts.en:
Viktr P. was born in 1986 in Vedi city. He is married and has a newborn son. For about two years Viktr worked as a teacher in Vedi’s N3 secondary school. Now he works as a computer operator in one of Vedi’s companies. His wife is unemployed and she takes care of their baby. Simultaneously with his work as operator, Viktr is engaged in cattle-breeding and land cultivation. Thanks to his farming, Viktr has the opportunity to provide for his young family.

Viktr is seeking a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams (AMD), which will allow him to buy three calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy three calves and fodder for farm animals

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine W. is a 48-year-old widowed lady who has singlehandedly taken care of her two children who are now in the secondary level of education. She has been able to achieve this by running two businesses: a retail shop and a poultry farm. Her retail shop is next to the road so she gets to serve a number of customers who travel the road.

Josephine joined KADET after an introduction by staff on an awareness campaign and she has requested her first loan. She plans to use the funds to add more stock to her shop like cooking fats, detergents, biscuits, and other items and she also wants to use part of the loan to buy poultry feeds.

Josephine hopes to use the profits that she will earn, to invest in a hotel (restaurant) business. Her future plan is to open a wholesale shop and she believes that her hard work will definitely get her there.

loans.use: To buiy more stock for her retail shop and also poultry feed

loans.name: Keresenja

texts.en:
Keresenja W. is a 51-year-old widow with one son who is aged 27 years and currently in college.

Keresenja runs a dairy business in  Bungoma area and he has been in this, for about eight years.  He is able to make a profit of about Kshs 2,300 per month from the sale of milk to his customers who come from within the town.
 
Keresenja has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the money to buy a bull for farming purposes.

Keresenja hopes to use the profits he will make to improve his brick-molding business, which has not picked up well, and thus be able to supply bricks within his town. He believes anything is achievable with hard work.

loans.use: To buy a bull for farming purposes

loans.name: Joseph Risa Ole

texts.en:
Joseph Risa Ole M. is 51 years old. He is a farmer and supports 15 people in his family. His spouse is Naponu M. and they have children aged between 3 and 19 years. Naponu is a housewife and she helps Joseph in his farming activities. Joseph does wheat farming, and has been doing so for the last 20 years.

This will be his fourth loan and he is planning to spend 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer and 19,000 shillings on the cost of spraying his wheat farm. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

His dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and will be financially stable to support his family in the near future.

loans.use: To spend 40,000 shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer and 19,000 will be used to pay for the cost of spraying his wheat farm

loans.name: Elijah Murimi

texts.en:
Elijah Murimi K. is 42 years old, and he supports a family of three. His spouse is Mary Wambui, who is a housewife. Elijah is a businessman running a shop in Narok town. He sells carpets, wall curtains and materials for making clothes to the tailors who are his frequent customers. He has been in this business for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of the group. This will be his fourth loan, which he is planning to use to buy more curtains and materials to increase his stock. He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another shop.

Elijah’s dream is to become a wholesale seller and distributor in Narok town. He is a hardworking man with a great vision.

loans.use: To buy more textiles and other materials to increase his stock

loans.name: Kuuki Ole

texts.en:
Kuuki Ole N. is 26 years old, and he is married to Noomuyia N.. 

Kuuki is a farmer. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 KES buying chemicals and fertilizers for tomatoes that he has already planted, and 20,000 KES to prepare land to plant more tomatoes. His area has favorable climatic conditions for tomato farming, thus keeping him focused on farming only. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plough a bigger piece of land to increase tomato production.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer in vegetable farming and also start fruit farming. He also hopes that one day he will own some farm machinery to make his farming more efficient and economical.

He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers, and prepare land to plant more tomatoes

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Philip N. is a 40-year-old gentleman who is married to Dina Wamalwa. They have two children, who are both still in school. Philip operates two businesses of poultry farming and plastic shoe selling within the Bungoma area. He has been doing this for two years now, and he is able to take home 2,500 KES per month. 

Philip has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to buy more shoes for resale, as well as to buy poultry feeds. He hopes to make a good profit that he will plough back into the business.

His future plans include becoming a wholesale trader who will sell leather shoes and also stabilize the income for himself and his family. He says that his commitment will help him achieve this feat.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and shoes for resale in his secondary business
