loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma V. is from the village of Guibang, Gamu, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elma makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling rice cakes for sale in front of the church. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kageni Enole

texts.en:
Kageni Enole G. is 61 years old and she supports three members of her family. Her spouse is Miringan G. ,who is a farmer. They both do farming on their own piece of land.

She has been rearing cattle for the last four years. Her aim is to buy young rams during the dry season when they are not very costly, then place them in her farm which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season, when they have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy three young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

Her future dream is that she will become a large-scale farmer in cattle rearing. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To spend 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) to buy three heifers at Ksh10,000 each

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius O. is a 59-year-old gentleman who is married to Gladys O. and together they have three children ages 14, 10 and 7 years. He buys bread which he later sells retail to shops and schools within his locality at a profit. He is able to make a profit of Kshs 7,500 and this has been his business for the past four years.

Julius has applied for his first loan with KADET and he plans to use this loan to buy more bread for resale. He believed his hard work will pay off and he will be able to open his own bakery and also be able to steadily support an orphanage.

loans.use: To buy more bread for resale

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a single man who has been operating his motor vehicle business for the last year. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a public vehicle license and new tires.

He has no other source of income. Hamadi faces the major challenge of high competition in his business. His major goal is to own a big motor vehicle (matatu) company. He decided to work with Yehu so as to get income to boost his business. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a public service vehicle license and new tires.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa D., 36, lives with her husband and one child in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Her child attends a university while her husband works in a secondary school as a guard. Ariunaa used to work in the floor industry as a laboratory assistant. 

She operates a meat trading business at Baigal-Eej local market. She has operated this business for the last eight years and has become quite a successful businesswoman. She has used her business earnings to cover her household's expenditures and to improve the quality of her family's lives. Her earnings also have enabled her to pay her child's tuition fees.

Ariunaa is an open-minded, generous and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more meat to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Nilabo, Rizal. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture making & selling furniture. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for furniture production

loans.name: Michael Otieno

texts.en:
Michael Otieno O. is 45 years old and he supports four members of his family. His spouse is Jane Otieno who is a businesswoman and generates an income of about Ksh10,000.They have three children, aged 21 years, 16 years and 5 years old.

Michael is a businessman and he specializes in men’s suits, which he has been doing for the last ten years in a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET LTD from a market awareness program done by KADET staff within Narok Town. This will be his seventh loan with KADET and he has paid off the previous loans on time with no default. He is planning to spend the money on buying more suits to add to his current stock.

From the anticipated profit from the expanded business, Michael will pay college and school fees for his children. He also anticipates opening up another shop in a different street within Narok Town.

His hope and dream is that he will own a house where he can operate the shop and become a wholesale trader. He is a hard-working and business-oriented man.

loans.use: To buy more men's suits to add to his stock

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 48 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector more specifically, in fish vending. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en:
Marivic S. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 29 years old. Marivic is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is a widow and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector in hog raising. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest as additional capital for the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marivic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel C. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 27 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lizel owns & operates a business venture in the clothing sector,  selling ready-to-wear items. Lizel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lizel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lizel is requesting her 1st loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her existing business. She plans to use her additional revenue generated from her business to pay for her child's education.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for clothing sales

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy D. is from the village of Mapang, Rizal. She is 32 years old and single. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for snack vending

loans.name: Efrelyn

texts.en:
Efrelyn Z. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 27 years old. Efrelyn is married. To make a living, Efrelyn owns & operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local members in the community. Efrelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Efrelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efrelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Efrelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Parsinante Ole

texts.en:
Parsinante Ole P. is 27 years old. He is married to Kirotina Mpurunyuk and is the father of three children aged 6 years, 4 years and 2 years old. Parsinante is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Parsinante's dream is become a large-scale farmer and buy his own vehicle to transport the farm produce to different markets. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend  Kshs.50,000 to prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children of whom one attends school and the other is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family budget. She has been operating her business of selling second-hand clothes for the last seven months, selling to adults from door-to-door. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants start a vegetable stall, to purchase a sack of green vegetables and fruit. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. She hopes to start a bigger vegetable stall in future. Her major aim in working with Yehu is to get financial assistance and educate her children. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of green vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Ferival

texts.en:
Ferival C. is from the village of Villaluz. He is 24 years old. Ferival is married. To make a living, Ferival owns & operates a business venture a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local members in the community. Ferival has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ferival joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ferival is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ferival from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nooretet Enole

texts.en:
Nooretet Enole K. is 34 years old. She supports six members of her family. She has been rearing cattle for the last eight years. She buys young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then places them in her farm which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season, when the bulls have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy four more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, she intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

Her future dream is to become a large-scale farmer in cattle rearing. 

She is a hardworking woman and is determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy four more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 30 years old. Jennifer is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer is just starting this business. In 2010, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija, a married woman with one child who attends school, is married to a motor vehicle driver who supports the family financially. For the past four years, Khadija has been operating her business from home, selling water taps to her neighboring community. With a loan of Kshs 30,0000, she wants to purchase two water tanks. Khadija faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially droughts. Her major goal is to purchase big water tanks and supply to the entire community to enable her to operate during dry seasons.

She joined Yehu because of its good customer relations. Khadija rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase two water tanks.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar S., who is married and has two children, lives in the village of Baghramyan in the Shirak region of Armenia. With his wife, he cultivates land and keeps a small farm which provides some income for the family. Mkhitar has applied for this loan to cultivate three hectares of wheat and expand the farm.

loans.use: To cultivate 3 hectares of wheat and expand the farm

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Precilla owns a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local members of the community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Precilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Precilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Lasoi

texts.en: Lasoi is a farmer who has farmed her own piece of land for the last ten years. She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her second loan, thirty thousands shillings, to prepare the land for planting potatoes, which normally do well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Lasoi's dream is to build a nice house and see her people advance academically. She is a hard-working woman who, with financial support,  can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina G. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 58 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Rosalina operates a motorcycle transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 4000 PHP to maintain the vehicle used in her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en: Chuluuntsetseg C. is 53 years old and lives with her husband, children and grandchildren in Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband, Dorjpalam, is disabled and receives a pension, but he also helps in his wife's business. In order to support her family, she sells firewood and coal from her home. She also sells wellness and health products. She started selling a firewood and coal in 2005 and started giving eutrophy advice and selling health products in 2009. In the future, she hopes to expand both her businesses and establish healthy diet club. Chuluuntsetseg is a very friendly and honest person who says " I love my business, because it helps people to live a healthy life and I want to open a healthy diet club." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to establish a eutrophy (health) club.

loans.use: To establish a eutrophy (health) club

loans.name: Marikae Enole

texts.en:
Marikae Enole N. is 41 years old. She is married to N. Ntemel and the mother of six school-age children. Marikae has been a farmer for the last five years. Her farm is in a productive area and most of her customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy her produce to sell in the city. 

She learned about KADET LTD through an awareness program by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan, fifty thousand KES, to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre potato farm. Potatoes do very well in this area and have high yields due to fertile soil and adequate rainfall. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more farm land to meet the demand for farm produce. Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have her own farm machinery. Marikae is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre potatoe farm.

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en: Delgertsetseg S. lives with her husband and one son in their own ger (a traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son works for a construction company. Delgertsetseg's husband, Buyanjargal, receives a government retirement pension. She sells consumer goods at the biggest market in Narantuul. She started her business in 1999, purchasing various products from wholesale stores in Narantuul and reselling at retail prices. Her business earnings have enabled her to buy her own house. She plans to purchase more products to resell during the peak season for sales. Delgertsetseg works hard to grow her business and hopes to expand in the near future. She is a very modest and intelligent businesswoman who says, "All I want is to improve my household's quality of life." She is requesting a 500,000 tugrik loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Patrick Leitato Ole

texts.en:
Patrick Leitato Ole K. is 37 years old. He is married to Sirope K. and he is a father of one child. Patrick is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he is planning spend thirty thousand shillings to buy fertilizer and chemicals, and the remaining twenty thousand shillings on spraying his ten-acre wheat firm. 

His dream is to become a large-scale wheat farmer and own some farm machinery.

He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and chemicals; paying for crop spraying

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with two children: one attending school and the other one still too young for school. Zainab lives in her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Her husband is a driver by profession and he contributes to meet the family's basic needs. 

Zainab has been selling fried potatoes for over one year. She sells from home to the neighboring community and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes. She hopes that in future she will open a hotel (restaurant) and attract many customers. She decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of potatoes

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with four children, of whom three attend school and one is still too young for school. She has been operating her business of selling khangas (cloths worn as garments) for the last six years to her neighbors, especially women, from door to door. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a bale of khangas. Her major challenge is delay of payments by customers after selling on credit. Her major goal is to open a wholesale shop in the future. Asha decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. She owns a house with electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of khangas.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren D. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Darhan-Uul Province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All her children attend a local secondary school. She operates a business selling meat products at a rented stall in a local market with the help of her husband. They began their business with working capital of 40,000 MNT in 2001. After nine years of successful operations they have managed to increase their working capital to a level exceeding 850,000 MNT today. Their business earnings are the only income for their family. In the future, they plan to establish their own meat market. Dolgorsuren is a very diligent and hardworking woman and says "My husband and I hope to raise our children to be highly educated and good people." She is requesting a 2,000,000-MNT loan to purchase intestines of sheep and cows at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase intestines of sheep and cows

loans.name: Joyce Lanoi

texts.en:
Joyce Lanoi L. is 43 years old and her spouse is Samante Oyie. She supports four members of her family. Her spouse is also a farmer and they do the farming together on their own piece of land, which they have been doing for the last seven years.

This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing their land for planting potatoes.

She is planning to use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to increase her farm production by ploughing more acres, and also educate her children.

She has been paying back her loan successfully without default. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and also see her children get to a better school with good learning facilities.

loans.use: To prepare their land for potato planting.

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math S. is a 30-year-old single man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is an internal employee in a modern casino and is able to earn $330 a month. He started his job more than nine years ago. Math S. lives with his young brother who works in a private company. In the past, Math S. paid a lot of money to hire a taxi to travel to work because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. Math S. hopes to cut down on the cost of hiring taxis by using a loan he has requested to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Koken Ene

texts.en:
Koken Ene M. is 50 years old. She is married to Oloshorua M. and she is a mother of two children.

She is a farmer, and has been farming her own piece of land for the last seven years. She grows wheat, and has been quite successful at this due to good climatic condition in her area.

She learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing the land for wheat planting. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is to plough a bigger piece of land and increase her wheat production.

She is a hard-working woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya G. lives with her husband and two children in her own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends Otgontenger University, while her son is currently studying for his bachelor's degree at the Mongolian Science and Technology University. Her husband works in a construction college as a teacher. 

Gantuya operates a women's lingerie retail business from a stall at the biggest market in Narantuul. She sells a variety of different lingerie items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many customers. She started her women's lingerie business in 2000. She imports her products from Erlian, a border city of China, twice a month. Her business location is good. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing her working capital during the peak season for sales. She is a very modest and hardworking person and says, " I want to help with my sister's children's education." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase more lingerie with an increase in her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more lingerie

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman with three children; two attend school but the third is still too young to go. Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he contributes to the family's needs.

She has been operating her business of selling khangas (lesos), which are patterned cotton cloths, for the last seven months; she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase a bale of khangas. She has no other source of income. Violet faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a cosmetic shop in the future.  

Violet Lives in a rented house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She joined Yehu because of its good reputation.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of khangas

loans.name: Ronta

texts.en:
Ronta L. is 37 years old. He is married to Parane L. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Ronta farms his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last eight years. He learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he is planning to spend twenty-five thousand Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm. 

He is anticipating buying some farm machinery with the profit from his expanded farming activity.

He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to spend twenty five thousands to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Serah Muthoni

texts.en:
Serah Muthoni K. is 52 years old. She is married to Philip Munyua and she is the mother of two children. 

She has been farming her own piece of land for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staff in the area where she lives. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend thirty thousand Kenyan shillings to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can do commercial farming. 

She is a hard-working woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: preparing a farm for and planting wheat

loans.name: Meu

texts.en: Meu F. is a 60 year old widowed mother caring for five children. All five children are still living in the family home and are employed in different jobs. Meu F. is a recycling seller--she buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires. Meu F. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase her profits. Meu F. will provide part of the loan she requested for her son to use as capital for his clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to increase her profits.

loans.name: Mary Nareiyio

texts.en:
Mary Nareiyio K. is 63 years old. She is married to K. and the mother of seven children. She operates a retail shop that she has been running for the last three years in the Ololulunga shopping center in the outskirts of Narok Town.

She learned about KADET Ltd. from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her second loan. She is planning to increase her shop's stock by buying more soft drinks, especially during this sunny season, as she knows their demand will be high. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. 

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and be running the shop at her own premises.
 
Mary also believes she is hard-working and she only needs resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: increasing stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel S. is 29 years of age and is happily married to Jerald S., who is a security guard. The couple was blessed with three children whose ages range from two to eight years old. Two of her kids are in school and one kid is a two year old baby.  They are accumulating bigger amounts of expenses each year. Through a business she has been growing since Maricel had her own family until the present, she has been able to support the education of her children. 

Maricel's fattening (raising pigs in four months and selling after that) business started to grow when she had availed herself of a loan after she became a member of ASHI. 

Because of the success she found in her business, the loan she applied for will be used to purchase more piglets to raise. She hopes that her business will prosper and that she can have the ability to start up another business supported by the profit from her hog raising so that she can employ some of the members of her family, especially her extended relations in the village.

Her long term goals are to have a full-fledged pig farm business, invest in her home, send her children to school until they complete college, and embark on another venture - a sari-sari store. “Sari” is a native word for variety. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ezekiel Parkurito

texts.en:
Ezekiel Prkurito S. is 56 years old. He is married to Rachael Ninaai and is the father of six children.  Ezekiel is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend fifteen thousand on harrowing, fifteen thousand on seed and ten thousand on planting his five acre wheat farm.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming by ploughing a bigger piece of land for wheat planting.  Ezekiel's dream is to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and buy his own farm machinery. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to harrow, seed & plant his five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mr. Soung S. (pictured here) is 61 years old and his wife, Mrs. Neng Nhao, is 58 years old  They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 15 kilometers. They have been married since 1972 and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home and another one stays at home. 

Soung and his wife are vegetable farmers. The couple does not have capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their vegetables, so Soung is asking for his first loan of $150 to help his capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Isaack Martine

texts.en:
Isaack Martine N. is 28 years old. He is married to Gladys Nanyikae and he is the father of two children, aged 3 years and 6 years. He has been rearing cattle for the last three years. He buys young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then places them in his farm, which he has purposely fenced for grazing. After the rainy season and the bulls have fattened, he sells them at a profit.

He learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy five more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer in cattle rearing. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy five more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, a 56-year-old resident of Riwind for the last 25 years, is married to 60-year-old K. M.. A very hardworking lady, she has operated a milk-selling business for over 20 years. At her home Rasheedan has two buffalo whose milk she sells to her neighboring customers. She gets approximately 16 kilograms of milk from her buffalo, selling each kilogram for 45 PKRs, thereby earning approximately 720 PKRs each day. Her income is a major source of financial support for her family.

Her husband is involved in an animal-selling business, purchasing them at an early age, raising and then selling them for a good profit. He has operated this enterprise for the last 15 years.

Rasheedan has given birth to three sons and one daughter. Her eldest and youngest sons help her in getting milk from the buffalo, while her middle son works in a factory. Her daughter, 17, stays at home and manages the household chores.

Rasheedan is requesting a loan from Asasah to buy another buffalo and expand her milk-selling business. She feels that she can serve a larger number of clients by purchasing another buffalo and increasing milk productivity.

A regular user of Asasah, this will be her sixth loan. In previous loans, she has proven herself to be a responsible client who never misses a single meeting and pays her installments on time. Note: She is with her elder son in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda H. (shown in the photo), 40, is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of tH. are in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Chenda is a garment factory worker. She also rents space in her house to other garment factory workers. This works out well because her house is located near the garment factory. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build additional rooms to rent and generate more income.

loans.use: To build additional rooms to rent.

loans.name: Nkaiwatei Shadrack

texts.en:
Nkaiwatei Shadrack K. is 23 years old. He is married to Miriam and he is a father of a one-year-old child. He has been raising cattle for the last three years. His target is to buy young heifers during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on his farm, which he has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season and the bulls have fattened, he sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

He learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy six more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His dream is to become a large-scale farmer raising cattle. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy six more young bulls for fattening to sell latter

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan D. is 29 years old and lives with wife and two children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). He has a gold and silver crafts business which he inherited from his ancestors. He has much skill as a craftsman and designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. Batsaihan has been in his business for more than 15 years. During this time, he has worked hard to grow his crafts business. He has been saving his earnings to begin renting a stall at the local market in the near future. He is a very modest, kind and open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to use for his craft business.

loans.use: To rent a stall at the local market

loans.name: Adella

texts.en: Adella O. T. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  Adella has a retail shop. She has been in this business for nine years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Adella sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Adella has requested  for a loan of 1,200,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, bags of rice, beans  and maize flour. She also generates additional income through renting motorcycles.The main business challenges for Adella include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goal and aspiration for her business is to get enough profit to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT because of small amount of interest charged.  Adella lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, rice, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en:
Kimanyisho N. is 23 years old and she supports three members of her family. Her spouse is Meiponyi N. who is a farmer and they both do farming on their own piece of land. She has been raising cattle and sheep rearing for the last four years. Her target is to buy young rams during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on her farm, which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season when they have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to use to buy ten rams and three young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

Her dream is to become a large-scale cattle and sheep farmer. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy ten rams and three young bulls

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram H. is married with one child. He supports a large family with parents and pensioner grandparents. Before starting serviette production, he worked as a delivery man for a meat factory, contacting numerous clients in various regions of Armenia. To be more financially secure, he decided to start his own business. Knowing many retail shop owners helps him a lot in his business now. Currently Aram has large orders for which he needs to order large volumes of packaging.

loans.use: To order large volumes of packaging for serviettes

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg Z. is a 42-year-old widower who lives with his children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He had been operating a grocery business at a local market in his town since 2000. He started driving a taxi in 2006 and has found success. He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. He also is able to pay his son's tuition fees. Erdenebileg is an open-minded and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to improve his car's condition. The car is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car's condition

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the village of Namnama. She is 48 years old. Ofelia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business planting and selling vegetables in the market. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Kokoiyian Ene

texts.en:
Kokoiyian Ene K. is 54 years old and she supports seven members of her family.  She has raised cattle for the last eight years. Her target is to buy young heifers during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on her farm, which she has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the bulls have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy five more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, she intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

Her dream is that she will become a large- scale cattle farmer. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy young bulls

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Namnama. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business planting & harvesting vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman with two children who both attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family needs. She has been operating her business selling second-hand clothes for the last four years. She sells to women by going door-to-door. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of Khanga's. Her major challenges in the business are seasonality and transportation. She hopes to open a shop in the future. Lucy decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business. She lives in a rental houses with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Khanga's.

loans.name: Tirigot Ole Kerenge

texts.en:
Tirigot Ole Kerenge N. is 24 years old. He is a farmer and supports four people in his family. His spouse is Nayengiyengunye and they have two children who are eight and two years old. Nayengiyengunye is a housewife and helps Tirigot in his farming activity.

Tirigot does wheat farming, which he has been doing for the last five years. This will be his second loan and he plans to spend it to prepare his five-acre farm for planting wheat. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable to support his family. He is a hard-working man and determined to achieve his objective.

loans.use: To prepare his land for planting wheat.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio D. R. Jr. is from the village of Soyung Echague. He is 39 years old. Antonio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,700 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).    

Sauda has a business of  frying samosas, chapats and pancakes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sauda sells her products at the nearby schools on a retail basis.    

Sauda has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of wheat flour, cooking oil and cowpeas (a legume). She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Sauda include transportation, the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of cooking oil, wheat flour and charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university. Sauda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of wheat flour, jerrycans of cooking oil and cowpeas (a legume)

loans.name: Patrick Maina

texts.en:
Patrick Maina W. is 27 years old and he supports a family of two. His spouse is Lucy Kemunto, who is a businesswoman contributing an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Patrick is a businessman running an electronic shop in Narok town. He sells electronics, such as mobile phones, and also does some repairs and battery charging. He has been in this business for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD. through a friend who is already a registered member with KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more electronic goods to increase his stock.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another shop.

Patrick’s dream is to become a wholesaler and distributor of electronic goods in Narok town.

He is a hardworking man and with the right resources, he can do great.

loans.use: To buy more electronic goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a resident of Riwind city, which is located near Lahore. This city is famous for its dairy and agriculture industries. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a three-room brick house. She has been living in this city from a young age.
 
Her husband's name is F. H. and he works as a government employee. Sughran supports her family financially by operating a grocery shop adjacent to her home. She started this business six years ago and it is working well now. 

She has two sons and a daughter and all of them are getting an education. Sughran and her husband make the best efforts to be able to afford the education expenses of their kids so they never face the same destiny that they faced in their early age. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her grocery shop. With the loan amount, she will buy daily-use items like bath soaps, rice, cooking oil, lentils and spices for her shop. She hopes that her investment in the business will prove to be a productive one and it will make a good return for her. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her sixth loan cycle. In previous loan years, she proved herself to be a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah O. lives with his wife, his son and his son's family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Narmandah's son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren live with him in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

He operates and manages a traditional shoe-making business with his wife. He has been making and selling traditional shoes with white soles, called the Buriad shoe, in Narantuul -- Ulaanbaatar's largest market -- since 1998. His oldest son also produces traditional Mongolian boots and sells them at their family stalls in the market. His business is in popular spots to attract customers. 

Narmandah is a hardworking person and plans to produce more boots of different types. He is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to grow his working capital by expanding his product line.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia C. is from the village of Basag, San Carlos, Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Sofia is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Sofia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sofia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Sofia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Sofia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou S. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 41 years old. Marilou is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou sells cosmetic products. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Kasina

texts.en:
Elizabeth Kasina is a 60-year-old lady married to Peter. They have five children.

Elizabeth manages the family farm which gives them a monthly profit of about 18400 kenya shillings that is able to take care of their family needs. She has also been operating a greengrocer business for the past thirty-seven years.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET by a KADET credit officer through marketing outreach. This is her first loan and she wants to use it to add more stock of tomatoes, oranges, potatoes and other fruits to her business. She intends to use the profit generated from the business to plow back into her business and farm.

Elizabeth’s hopes and dreams are to do more farming and keep animals. She also hopes to improve her family’s living standard and educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children who all attend school.  She owns a house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Her husband is a doctor and he supports his family financially.

Mejumaa has been operating her business of selling short cakes, flat bread (chapati) and sweet dumplings for the last ten years, selling to her neighbors and to passersby. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

Mejumaa faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a cereals shop in future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to obtain financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros M. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and is married with seven school-aged children. Milagros owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expenses.

Betty has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for five years and works six days a week. She sells her products retail at her shop. She also generates additional income from rental rooms.

Betty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenges for Betty include transportation and the rainy season.

Betty’s goal and aspiration for her business is to start importing secondhand clothes herself.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson L. is from the village of Palacapao Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 38 years old and is single.

Nelson owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nelson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Nelson is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 7th from HSPFI he chose to avail same amount of his previous loan. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Grace Luzili

texts.en:
Grace Luzili is 24 years old and is married to Francis M. who is a cereal seller. They both bring in an income of Kshs 15,000 which they use in support and supplementing the family needs. They have three school-going children aged 6 years, 4 years and 2 years. They live in Migori town.

Grace is in the business of selling sweet potatoes and has been in this business for the last three years. (She is the lady in a red top and the other ladies are her colleagues in the market). She is applying for a loan of Kshs 15,000, this being the first loan that she is accessing from KADET after being introduced by a friend. She intends to use the money to buy more sweet potatoes to add to her stock.

Grace hopes to build a permanent home for the family in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is a 67-year-old widow who lives with her three unmarried children, aged from 30 to 25 years, in Botbot, Pandan, in the province of Antique. Two of her children are college graduates and the youngest is a high school graduate.

Cristina did not want anything in her life other than to give her children a better living, which means their reaching a higher level of education and having a better house to live in someday. The best way Cristina thought to achieve her dream for her children and to make herself happy, was to have her own expanded business and to have grandchildren someday.

There is a piece of land which is owned by Cristina's family that can be used for farming. Cristina joined ASHI to obtain a loan which enabled her to utilize their land by planting rice. With the help of her oldest child, Camilo, their business has grown. Her loans have also increased in size as she has repaid her previous loans while maintaining a very good performance in ASHI.

Recently, Cristina applied for a loan which is intended for her other business endeavor - a hog-fattening business. However, this does not mean that her farming business will be stopped because some portion of her loan will still be used for it. Hog fattening is just Cristina's way of saving in case her farming business has a problem and needs more capital.

loans.use: To support her hog-fattening business and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria M. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Desideria owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members and her husband is the driver. Desideria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Desideria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desideria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools to improve and maintain the business. This loan will be Desideria's 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Naljirmaa

texts.en: Naljirmaa Y. , age 57-year-old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her younger son attends University. She used to work in a local school as a teacher and has retired in 2009. Since then, she rents and operates a cafe at a local school with help of her husband. She plans to purchase more tools and equipments for her cafe and make her cafe more convenient and comfortable. She hopes to expand her products line in order to attract more customers. She is very laborious and open minded person and says " I will increase my business profits and help my son to create his own family." Naljirmaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to decorate her cafe and purchase equipment and supplies such as chairs and tables

loans.use: To decorate her cafe and purchase equipment and supplies

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza M. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her young sister and brother). She lives in a home that she owns, having access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expenses.

Specioza has a poultry-farming business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products from her home, both wholesale and retail. Her main business challenges include transportation and poultry diseases. She also generates additional income through selling cement and iron bars.

Specioza has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed and more chicks. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own 2,000 laying birds.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and more chicks

loans.name: Miraji

texts.en:
Miraji is married to a businessman and has six children who all attend school. She lives at a rented house with electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Miraji’s business is selling clothes, handbags and shoes. She has been operating for the last two years, selling in a shop and also by selling door-to-door to her neighbors and to passersby. Her major challenge in her business is seasonality.

Miraji decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stock of shoes, clothes and handbags. She hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes, clothes and handbags

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya K. is a 46-year-old who lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. She and her family have been living in their current address for past twenty years. Her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. Her husband is currently unemployed but, during summer time, he runs a construction business to support his family. Her older son works as a furniture maker in Kazakhstan.

Marziya operates a small cafe in her town. She started her cafe business at a local market in 2005 and has since built a stable and successful operation though her cafe is not decorated nicely.

Marziya is a very hardworking and honest person. She is very hopeful for the future and says, "I want to save money for my children's further education." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to use for her older son's wedding.

loans.use: To use for her older son's wedding

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is 57 years old and a member of Mumbuni Wa Mundu self-help group in Faulu Kenya. She joined the group as an entrepreneur who sells clothes, shoes and beauty salon products. She also does farming for extra income.

Unice appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to keep her business running. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES with which she will buy more beauty products, clothes and shoes.

Unice has five children, four above eighteen years and one still in school. She hopes to assist her children to be independent and to own plots or land for doing business.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products, clothes and shoes to sell
